-keEdT-lbX2oMy9UEbxpyw.text: We had a great time! My husband and I sat at the bar on a very busy Friday night. The bartenders were busy but still took the time to be friendly and helpful. The beer selection is great. We ordered two appetizers: the tuna and crab cakes. Both were delicious! The decor is really nice as well.   We're visiting from Atlanta, but will definitely return if we're in the area again!

e0ZY8xBq8ZN6uBGBbT66OQ.text: In Pittsburgh for steelers game, came here on recommendations from others, and all I can say is WOW.  Beer selection was top notch, as well as bourbon selection.  Food was amazing and the portions were amazing.  Staff was over the top good, very attentive and made sure we were well taken care off.  The best place we visited while in town, don't miss this place while in Pittsburgh

t8ihtw8NlJQcZPvjdXch0w.text: Our visit to the industry public house in Robinson Township was terrific! We were there on St Patrick's Day, and the staff was all dressed up and very festive. Had a delicious hamburger with a yummy cider ale. Hubby had their special fish sandwich. Will go back again!

W8skw6ZIiwLcuODLaxYphg.text: Place is filthy.  Sat 15 min and no one waited on us.  Probably a good thing.  Never to return.

xDuqBS3ydttnziMhTbjLhg.text: Awesome atmosphere and great food. More beers in tap than j know what to do with! Joe was super helpful on food and drink recommendations. Double thumbs up to this place. If you're in the area, it's a must go.

fSB8PcKz3PkJlkCidab27Q.text: I live in Ohio and came to visit a friend that was here from out of town too. We read the reviews and decided to stop by. First of all I did the check in online and when I arrived my table was ready. Our waiter was very nice and also brought us samples of different taps so we could make a better decision. We decided to go for the mozzarella appetizers due to the reviews and we were so glad that we did. Best mozzarella appetizer ever! For dinner my friend had the Reuben sandwich and the portion was great but the sweet potatoes OMG so good! I decided to try the flatbread with the Mac and cheese and I can't describe the flavor but you have to try it and venture out as I did. We can't wait to come back to Pittsburgh and I will be back! Keep up the great job

UDp_9ZF8jvXTf2lj_dG73Q.text: This place is o.k.  We have been here a few times (the one in Lawrenceville and in North Fayette).  I think we always have a higher expectation.  The cocktails are good, with a seasonal menu and there are a lot of beers to choose from. Today, my husband and I went there for dinner.   He had a steak salad.  I had the ward 9 which is a salmon salad.  The steak salad was very over-dressed and the steak had a lot of fat and gristle.  My salmon was ok, not a lot of flavor in the salmon, but it was just o.k.  Also, we never got any refills on our waters, so I would rate the service as o.k. Our waitress was friendly enough, but didn't quite meet the mark.  I guess this place has the look and feel of other trendy, foodie restaurants with craft cocktails, but nothing about the experience really impressed us.

LtkpaDpX9n12MY2dNFbE9Q.text: Visited with friends, no host.. walked past three employees and no one greeted us. We ended up seating ourselves and eventually had to walk to an employee and ask for service. Three different people finally came to the table before we were settled into our server Tiannie. She immediately seemed annoyed that we were there and we asked for beer suggestions and she couldn't give us ANY guidance. We had to ask for our server twice to two separate employees. The only highlight was the food. A plus to whomever the cook was this evening. Other than that very disappointed.

uwmfyG3speGnAk-sObfzkw.text: Building has a lot of character. Liquor and beer selection is excellent. Food is good quality bar food.  A few drinks and dinner costed me 54 bucks. Not bad. I enjoyed my time there with friends. Go when not crowded when you are in a large group

eSW_QTepqlXngBrk8oyyEw.text: Blah.  This is another newish addition to Robinson that I had high hopes for, but has constantly underwhelmed me.  They can make a good burger.  I mean...they CAN.  They may not however.  I've had four burgers there and I'm 1 for 4.   Love the decor.  Edison bulbs are my jam.  I haven't done the smoked whiskey thing, which I guess is a big selling point.  Can't pass judgment on THAT.  I had a friend tell me it was good.   The food, to be fair isn't BAD.  It's just not good.  What is good...the filament fries.  Specifically the truffle oil and Gorgonzola filament fries.  Delicious.  So maybe come here for drinks and fries after you've already eaten dinner somewhere else.

0vQKKQCwOko2SdI5FMjDvg.text: A group of us went to the Industry Public House for lunch.  Waitress was VERY friendly and helpful.  I had the IPH which I really enjoyed and was priced fair.  To eat I had a burger with bacon and carmelized onions on it.  Burger was very tasty as well. Someone in our party had the Mac n cheese which looked like it should have been family style portion size.  I didn't think the place was that loud as other reviewers spoke of.  Overall based on the quality of the beer/food, and great waitstaff I would definitely return.  Keep up the good work.

aIFAJlkZo08J-roXUDS2iQ.text: I recently went there with a group of coworkers. The service was absolutely horrific. Guests at our table were choosing to go to the bar and get a drink rather than wait for our waiter who seemed nonexistent.  Every one of our checks was incorrect after only 2 rounds of drinks and we only discovered this because the waiter handed us all our checks before we were even done with our happy hour.   I gave this place a two only because the manager did come over and make things right. jOZE0oXacbJ4mmnlst_HQQ.text: Came here to look at apartments around the area. Seated very quickly and service was great! Had the impossible burger and the waitress even recommended my now favorite way to cook them. Great portions and taste, and a very comfortable atmosphere

SO5fhxTs6MjYmB7MOA1Jkw.text: Wednesday evening 6:00 the place was packed~!  I love the rustic feel of the establishment!  The entire building has been made over - no trace of Don Palbos (the restaurant it was before Industry)   Industry has plenty of personality and definitely trendy.  Our waiter was on the ball with our drink refills and I really enjoyed the "Copper Ale". It was tasty and not so heavy.   This isn't the type of restaurant that you will receive the over the top friendly staff service.  Its very busy and the wait staff isnt missing a beat.  Plus its very noisy - which is to be expected.  I have heard from friends that the menu items are a bit pricey but I thought it was pretty much standard. Its not a cheap night but affordable.  Honey Lime Sriracha Boneless Wines:    Ok I was sold when I read "Sriracha" and had to try these!  They were very tasty and love the kick of course.  Perfect to share and easy to eat.    Teamster Mozzarella Cogs: They were ok.  It was an expected taste and didn't  make my taste buds sing.. basic =meh.  No zing.  Candied Bacon:   Crispy and oh so tasty. Appetizer is ideal for 3-4 people. It's a lot for two people I thought.     After our little appetizer taste test - the bar area cleared out a little bit so we were able to get seats.  The service was ok at the bar. Left around 8:00 PM and still packed!   I look forward to my next visit.. for a burger.   It was a pleasant evening... thanks Industry

cckdseCZ753631ePUN50-A.text: For the price of the food I expect a lot more.  A LOT more! We arrived on a mid Sunday afternoon and there were just a few tables of people, most at the bar area watching football. Our waitress was great but even a good waitress can't make up for mediocre food :(  I ordered the most expensive burger on the menu, the lamb burger. I was so excited because the last lamb burger I had in Hawaii was THE best burger I have ever eaten. I don't know if I'll ever order another lamb burger after trying to eat the one I got at Industry Public House. First off I was asked how I wanted it cooked, I said medium. Not only was it grossly overdone, it had absolutely zero flavor. None. Zilch. Nada. It was tasteless! The patty was also packed too tightly, they tried to crush any goodness that was in that poor lamb to begin with. There was supposedly a cucumber mint vinaigrette on it, which was undetectable, and the mozzarella curds sounded sublime but they were basically frozen little nuggets of hard mozzarella fried and thrown on. What a total waste of $$!  My husband went with the Farmed Out Burger. He said it tasted fine, but he doesn't really have the most experienced palate so I always take his word with a grain of salt! If there's meat in it he is usually happy ;)  I did chuckle though when the first bite he took the over easy egg in his burger all spurted out the side of his bun. Clearly they didn't place that in the middle of the bun!  It was a disaster!  Overall I can say I know we will never be back here to eat. Maybe some of their other food is better, I did see good reviews for their salads. They did give a 20% military discount. Thank goodness for that, thank you!

WXvLpDr8QPTzn5HIbCOjjQ.text: Stopped for dinner at the bar. Drink order filled relatively quickly. Only a few seats left at the bar, but they weren't slammed. Bartender never asked for food order. Beer was flat. Waited 15 minutes then bailed. She rang the wrong beer. Paid it without protest (two bucks wasn't worth any more time) and without tip (and I can count on one hand the times I've ever left ANYWHERE without tipping). They get two stars because previous visits weren't this bad. However, they weren't good enough to bring me back again. When your best is mediocre to okay, and it's a small slide to non-existent service and flat beer, I'm done.

HSMcW0PP-M4hRKGeDGBgTQ.text: Gastropub 101 (GP101) - A term I've coined to cover the vast amount of restaurants opening up these days from coast to coast. You know the ones, a hand full of appetizers usually including wings as the main offering, overpriced burgers and sandwiches that you can make much better at home, and dinner offerings that proclaim over the top creativity and deliver forgettable plates of protein and starch with some bagged "fresh" vegetable of the day.  Another feature of this new breed of dining experiences is that they look and feel like they're either a chain or want to be a chain imitating the business models of the Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs, TGI Fridays etc. without taking the time to develop an actual good service and food plan upfront. I subscribe to the begin with the end in mind philosophy but you have to create a good product and reputation before you go big. And don't worry, I don't consider the examples stellar places to go but I do frequent them from time to to time because of their slightly elevated level of "didn't suck". My best experiences are and have always been the mom and pop's places that now join the ranks of the minority in any food scene theses days. Seek them out, give them credit where credit is due, and keep them alive through your patronage.  As a consumer and Yelper I try to give an honest opinion of my experience so you the potential customer can have enough information to go or not to any particular establishment. So now you know what I mean by GP101 you'll understand upfront that while there may be some variation in the place that is noteworthy the restaurant itself didn't suck, wasn't great, and was forgettable in the end.  I attempt to rate by service, ambiance, and quality of food with a clear understanding that the industry's operational tempo can change from day to day depending on a dynamic set of variables we call the human condition, todays great service might be tomorrows bad service just like all of us have off days so do restaurants. You can bet your bottom dollar that if I start off with the place sucked then it really sucked as I'm usually a kind yelper and look for the good over the bad.  Industry Public House: Service - good Ambiance - Unique and interesting sports bar (Only reason for the 3rd star) Food - Forgettable

w17addq4EoLZZu5XF2qoSA.text: In the light of day, this Industry location is much less exciting than its Lawrenceville counterpart.  I don't mean the ambience or even the menu--urban vibe and gastropub-style eats were perfectly up to par.  I just mean that if you're going to Lawrenceville for a laid-back dinner and and couple of drinks on a warm summer evening, and they've got the windows pulled open and the fresh air streaming in, you're likely not going to mind sitting there for a couple of hours while your food is being prepared, and your SO won't turn down the opportunity to nurse another beer.  But for a weekday team lunch out in Robinson, which is what I imagine a good majority of this location's traffic comes from, the service here is just downright inefficient.  My team of 8 waited spent about 2 hours here before we were able to receive our check, with 7/8 only ordering an entree, and no desserts ordered at all.  With a large table, I could perhaps understand this if we arrived in the middle of the lunch rush, but when we got there at an early 11am, the place was near deserted.  While luckily, none of us had anything pressing immediately after lunch that day, we collectively made a mental note to avoid this place for work lunches in the future.  The food just isn't special enough to warrant such a wait.

Their flat screens offer a "ticker" of their selections, but even from close range it's hard to see. (I pride myself on great eyesight).  I'm a sucker for a new place in the area for "happy hour" because I work close by, but this is a place that I would only go to every once in a while and only worked a 3 star wonder for me.

X_Lj62RNWL6rmEg7Cr588A.text: Why list the wait time on the app when it isn't accurate?  We checked the app and saw 0 min wait and went inside.  They told us a 30 minute wait.   I've continued to check the app which still states a 0 min wait.

jVR1jP22Qh4X8QBOHUZ2tQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here last minute on a Friday night. The parking lot looked packed, but I checked on the NoWait app and there was no wait (convenient!!). We were looking forward to a Friday night beer and this was the perfect place to go to. They have 3 of their own beers that that they brew and 2 pages of other beer on tap, so you will definitely find something you like! I had their Copper Ale, which was comparable to a Yuengling and I liked it a lot! We started off with an appetizer - the mozzarella cogs, which was mozzarella sticks, but in a disc shape. The marinara sauce that paired with this appetizer was really good! For our meals, we both had burgers. I had the Worker Burgher, which was topped with goat cheese, arugula and mushrooms. I looove goat cheese and this was delicious! Mike had the Farmed Out Burgher, which had white cheddar, bacon, BBQ, and a fried egg (which is his favorite topping on a burger!). He loved it. The burgers come with an insane amount of fries, that are really delicious. Our waiter was super friendly and helpful, especially when I needed to pick a beer. It is a little pricey there, but we will definitely go back to try other dishes on their menu!

Their whiskey and whiskey based cocktails are also good, especially the smoke stacks.  I have eaten here a number of times and the food has been hit or miss. aYFOuytdkaX-gpqoXNd8wQ.text: Industry Public House - interesting name considering all industry such as steel, mining and heavy manufacturing have all but left or have been ran out of the Pittsburgh region.   It seems Industry Public House has brought a new industry to south western Pennsylvania - Salt Mining.  Salt mining you ask? Yes. I will explain momentarily.   Having decided to try IPH on a whim, we sampled quite the variety of offerings. We tried the nacho's with chicken, which were very good. The chicken in them was excellent and the fresh jalapenos were great as well.   As far as entree's I had the Farm Burger. Beef, wild boar bacon, BBQ, white cheddar, and a undercooked, exceptionally runny egg. Bottom line up front, don't put the egg below the patty. While the beef patty was quite good, it was probably the slickest burger I'd ever partook in. First bite and everything slid off the bun. I chose to eat it with a fork. Sad, no longer a handheld  My girlfriend decided to have the boneless chicken bites, the hot parmesan, they were probably the best product which we tried. Th breading was nice and they were not overcooked. Probably the best part of the experience.  Also sampled were the pot roast fries. One forkful and they were sent back. We couldn't deduce whether it was the gravy, the beef, or the fries which were so exceptionally salty, but they were inedible.   The server had asked if something else could be substituted and an order of regular fries were brought over. They too were absolutely covered in sea salt. Large flakes of visible salt. Again, inedible.   I'm not sure if this is done so you choose to drink more or just an oversight. I'm usually one to notice if a food product is over salted, but it was not me this time who noticed how salty the product was.  The beer selection however was exceptional, that was the only redeeming quality of IPH to me.   I would also like to point out that the men's room was in dire need of cleaning.   It was a one and done kind of experience. Hopefully they can polish things up.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Incredibly salty fries. Straight outta Salt Lake City.

bf0nODLR6dTb8YHpk-kwCQ.text: Came here with the fam when we were out in the Robinson area. We enjoyed being able to find parking easily, which is a plus compared to the Lawrenceville location. The layout of the restaurant is awesome- definitely would be a great spot to come and watch a game or have a few drinks on Friday night. We started off with the fried pickles and the buffalo mac & cheese flatbread. My dad loved the flatbread and thought it was so unique. I really enjoyed both of the appetizers. I had the chicken sandwich for my main mail, which was delicious. My family enjoyed their meals as well. Our service was great and we had a great time! If I am in the Robinson area again and looking for somewhere to eat, we will be back!

gn9957yqDlmrCsflupU-7A.text: Love this new location of Industry Public House!! I had always thought the beverage selection and food were tasty in the original Lawrenceville location, but between tough street parking and a very hectic restaurant space, I was never super motivated to dine there. However, with this new location in the Robinson area, there's a large parking lot and a huge restaurant space that can seat hundreds of people. Plus, it's become my favorite restaurant to grab lunch or dinner before shopping at IKEA.  Food: Make sure to try the Industrial Size Soft Pretzel if you have 4 or more people in your party (or are just ready to enjoy a lot of carbs yourself). The pretzel is perfectly soft, and both the beer cheese and cinnamon icing sauces are great complements to it. I haven't personally tried the Built to Order Nachos, but my brother-in-law ordered them while in town last weekend, and I loved that the toppings were layered throughout the tortilla chips, not just all dumped on top. Plus, they looked super tasty! Both times that I've dined here, I've ordered the Fish 'n' Chips. The serving of beer-battered cod is enormous, and I'd recommend substituting sides for sweet potato fries and mac and cheese. The sweet potato fries are both soft and crispy with a sweet coating, and the mac and cheese has a rich and creamy and cheesy sauce.  Drinks: Industry has something for everyone as far as drinks, from beer, liquor, wine, and mixed drinks. Personally, I've only had the Spiced Pear Sangria. The beverage was OK, but I thought was a bit too fall-flavored to be on the menu year-round.   In addition to the good food and drinks, I've thought the service here has been strong, too, from prompt seating and food delivery to courteous service and frequent check-ins throughout the meal.  Already looking forward to coming back here next time I need to make an IKEA run. :)

ZEb-LtNpg4J2cwZtkQrudg.text: This place is tucked away from the rest of the restaurants and life in Robison, but deserves to be front and center. Between the tasty drinks and lick smacking food menu, I'm not sure why it's not more packed.  Shhh let's keep it our secret!  But honestly, I'm a huge fan. I had the best bartender/ waiter while sitting at the bar late one Sunday. There wasn't a question he couldn't answer about the food menu or the beer selection. His accuracy was on point too.   Do try one of the draft beers, but don't forget the liquor menu because the bartenders take extra care to get it just right.   I ordered a humongous soft pretzel. They warned that it was the size of my head... but I'm not that big headed this thing was the size of my torso! The beer cheese was pretty yummy that accompanied it.   I will be back. The intimate setting, great staff and killer menu will keep this place alive.

OZiu1gCWmpikowQAM5g7iQ.text: Very cool vibes from this restaurant/bar in a busy shopping area.   They have a wide variety of beers and their specialty cocktails are delicious.   There are 2 levels in the restaurant and I sat up top. There is a 2nd bar so we didn't have to wait as long. The bartender asked about of preference and gave us samples to try. I said I was a fan of Blue Moon and suggested a berry/citrus beer. I wasn't too impressed but a friend of mine who suggested cocktails suggested the Rhuby Rhuby Rhuby.   This wouldn't be my first choice but it was good. The flavors were good and the booze was strong. It was beautiful in a short glass with purple swirls with a large basil leaf.   The atmosphere on a Friday night was pretty relaxed. There were plenty of TV screens in this place but sitting on the 2nd level, you got to look around.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rhuby rhuby rhuby
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cocktails!

fh9l13hZO60IUaPES9UTpw.text: It's OK, but not nearly worth the prices they charge. The overall atmosphere/design is nice, but it's very noisy. It was hard to hear our waiter, and it was hard for him to hear us. The chairs were trendy, but way too hard and uncomfortable.  The food varied greatly. Some items like the fried mozzarella cogs were pretty good (but a little greasy). Other items like the club sandwich were much too dry. The fish and chips was good and bad - fish was incredible, fries were cold. Their house beers - meh. Nothing particularly wrong with them, but far from the quality I expect from craft brewing.  Desserts were also a hit and miss. The cheesecake got rave reviews, but the red velvet cake was dry and, while red, did not taste like red velvet. The cream cheese icing was grainy. One person got an ice cream cookie sandwich and was not given a spoon until he asked for it (and didn't get it until the ice cream was half melted). No one was given a clean dessert fork. We had to use our dirty dinner forks.   Their timing was horrible. We'd barely taken two bites of our appetizers before the entrees showed up - with one exception. We waited about another five minutes for the fish and chips to show up, and it didn't. We had to ask for it.  When we're spending over $50 a head, I expect much better food and service. While it wasn't so bad that I feel the need to warn people away from the place, I'll never be back.

hSjdBjN0UbpBvdYKdcJiXw.text: I went here last week with my friends on a Saturday night for dinner. This is my third time coming here and I usually have an enjoyable experience. I love the food but this time service was disappointing. I ordered truffle fries as an appetizer which never came out. When we asked for them, they finally came out after our dinner. I also ordered blue cheese with my wings, which had a black hair in it and this couldn't have been mine since I have blonde hair (quite gross). When we got our check we assumed the fries would at least be knocked off the check since they came out late and since the hair incident, but nope the check stayed the same. Overall, this was not the best experience.

JSjKnqp68qXBkL9FHNVcPQ.text: Non existent service! I visited on a Sunday afternoon and waited 15 minutes listening to servers fighting with each other before even bringing waters then when I requested service to place a simple drink order I waited another 10 minutes and no one came to take my order so I left. The restaurant was not busy at all! I have had a much better experience at the Lawrenceville location.

bO2PpwRw1nUbv7VRZSHpig.text: This was quite the find on the way to the airport.  The food was delicious and the service was great.  We came in for a late lunch on the way to the airport.  So glad we found this little gem. We had 3 different styled burgers, the Model Turkey and the Shaved Stack and they were all so good.  Next time we come back to the Burgh we will stop here.

EihBq42jtj0QL6aS_Y7Ugg.text: Service:  Good!  We were seated right away, outdoor seating was perfect for the weather, and our Waitress was quick, courteous, and my water glass was kept full.  Food:  Excellent!  We had the large pretzel appetizer, fried pickles, two orders of mac and cheese, and the breakfast burrito.  Everyone in attendance loved their food.  Pricing:  This is where I had to knock down a star.  Yes I get it that this is an out of the ordinary offering and that they use only the best in their recipes, but still lunch wise it was pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bWAHT2M_vifXJcvhJSEcHg.text: Go here. Order ANYTHING.   The atmosphere is warm, trendy and fun. The selection of beers (though I did not partake) was very impressive. Wait staff is knowledgeable and very helpful. The menus are brilliantly designed and are brought as individual sheets of unrefined paper on a rugged clipboard. Just Wonderful and in perfect keeping with the ambiance!   My husband and I ordered a pretzel appetizer. It was large enough to feed a small country. The dough was slightly sweet and crisp with big flakes of ball park size salt. Served upright and hot on a rack it was not only delicious but fun.   As an entree I ordered (apologies for getting the name wrong) farm house or farm fresh burger. It was also huge with bacon and a fried egg. A juicy perfectly cooked-to-order beef patty that was roughly the size of my head on a fresh bun. Knife and fork are required for eating.   Pass on the truffle fries.   I cannot wait to return.

6a87H4pSqZK9xSFhMti98g.text: They have a great selection of beer from around PA, NJ, OH and the food is not half bad.  They tend to rotate what is on tap which is a plus.

ozabmV5iV-12bcgfor5R_w.text: Was it good? YES! Industry public house is one of the few happening spots in West Allegheny, it's a new location, 5/5 ambience, 5/5 draft list, "so where does it come short?", you may ask... short answer food is a 3/5 at best and price you are paying is steep for the food you get.   What kills me is that i think a 4-4.5/5 is very achievable by industry public house- it is in a great location with only a handful of competitors. It has a phenomenal collection of brews and wonderful interior venue. It has a great menu, it just needs to focus on making it a great value compared to its competitors.   I would definitely recommend this restaurant to someone who's looking for a drink in West Allegheny, and I would definitely come back for a 3rd time.

Lq_cWa7F-GRra033aCn-mQ.text: Cool open space with plenty of tvs and many micro brews on tap.  Little pricey but a cool venue and vibe.

24akiL7c-duQfJVx8ydL7w.text: Hospital food. I had the pot roast and it had no gravy, no character and no flavor. But at least it wasn't cold like the appetizer.   They have 60 beers on tap, and about 50 of them are IPA's and taste exactly the same. And what's up with beer in cans?? Am I at a brewpub or a tailgate party??  At these prices, I shouldn't be thinking about swinging thru McDonalds on the way home, but I am.   This place sucks, avoid it if you can.

fCeNnT61jt_grBaRkMMo6g.text: This place is awesome!  The look of the building is very cool. TV's are everywhere. The food I tried was incredible. The burger I had was so good. Had candied bacon and candied jalapenos!   The beer selection was off the charts. Great beers that I have not had the chance to try before.  The people who work there were so nice and knowledgeable. I had a great time overall with the social aspect and the food/drink!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qYDU9qDyg1Kkfv4uPmXEtQ.text: Me and my boyfriend went there yesterday, and I must say, the macaroni and cheese was great and my boyfriend's pulled pork sandwich was amazing. The hostess could have been more friendly, but we all have bad days.

pr8MKxgoTmncfa5dvFhvTg.text: I went here with a party of 10 on a Friday afternoon during the lunch rush. I called ahead to see if we could have a table ready & they obliged. When I arrived they had us set up at the cutest table in a great location, pretty much by ourselves so we could be as loud as we wanted :)  We started off with the soft pretzel (honestly one of the best I've ever had in my life) the Buffalo Mac & cheese flatbread & the truffle fries. My only complaint about all of them is that I had to share. They were all so good!   I ordered the fish & chips for my main course and was very pleased. The portion was huge, I actually took half home, something this pregnant lady rarely does! Everyone at my table seemed very pleased with their meals. I did sample my friends grilled cheese and it was kind of out of hand how good it was. I've never seen a grilled cheese like that & know I have to get it next time I go back!   Our server lainey (sp?) was attentive, friendly and very accommodating! Exactly what you need when dealing with a rowdy group of 10!   I can't wait to go back.

GN6-9Nq1qSLK6EPVVKUNOA.text: This place was packed for all the right reasons. Excellent beer selection and awesome food. The popcorn starter wasn't my favorite but it was still good. The prime rib sandwich was better than I could have asked for. French fries were also perfect. Wait staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I'll be back.

WzV1Y9KleXP2aBP_CCL53w.text: Place was busy for a Thursday summer night. Grabbed two spots at the bar; it was packed. There were about 4 people tending bar. Seemed like some patrons got more attention than others, and we were on the non-receiving end of that service. Argh!   Finally got service. Great beer selection! Cold and fresh beverages. Took about 10 minutes to flag someone down to order food. The food came out quickly and was delicious. Turkey was smoky and yummy. Husband loved his smokestack, too. Also struggled to flag someone down for the bill, but we finally got there!   I'm willing to give the place another shot so I can taste that turkey again. Table service might be better than at the bar. Also, the bartenders may have been new.  Update: returned on a Thursday evening and grabbed a table. The server was attentive, and the food was good. Had the same dish as last time!

-ik7s4_zxq2QzzMBJUqLxQ.text: We just flew in to Pittsburgh -- home -- and decided to eat since it was five o'clock instead of fighting rush-hour traffic.   My review is based off of happy hour food and drinks.   We ordered the two "FF" specials: flat bread and french fries. The flat bread was delicious with homemade pesto and tomato and the french fries were loaded with braised beef and gravy, and let me tell you, my husband thought he died and went to country boy heaven. The beef was plentiful and tender with the perfect amount of gravy.   After telling the waiter what type of beer my husband liked, he brought a sample of one of their craft beers. Perfect choice!!! I had a glass of house Cabernet.   Two apps, two drinks, and our bill was less than twenty dollars!  Great food, great service, and great prices earns this place FIVE stars, and I'll be back next time I pick someone up at the airport or return from a trip, which is quite often, thankfully.

PSYr3nfM0w8kcWoXeeQWuw.text: Came in for a quick beer to just see the atmosphere. The place at first sight has a really nice rustic, industrial feel. The beer list was longer then normal and definitely had a beer for every pallet. We did not have any food but the options seemed unique including a duck burger stuffed with more duck. The only draw back was there was only one bar tender so service was a little slow. Will definitely come back to try a new beer and some food!
