xoOCZe4dLH-YSUCw6kUvcw.text: This is a great local bar/restaurant to go to in Robinson! Great drinks, food, service and atmosphere! My favorite dish is the Mac n Cheese!  I always have a good time there.

6qp-kkz7CiRO8cHzyjdMWw.text: A hot and new place in North Fayette, finally! If that's not enough excitement, I will am happy to say that this place's food is BOMB! I'm giving Industry Public House a reserved 4 stars for these reasons:  I am in love with the aesthetics and ambience of this place. It's a completely different feel from the Don Pablos that was there before. With a huge bar, the industrial setting, and clean environment, it gives this place a cool, hip, yet relaxed atmosphere that made the dining experience special.   The food was fantastic! I had the upsidedown chicken sandwich with fries. The "upsidedown" name comes from using an everything bagel upsidedown and they do the dirty by sandwiching a juicy chicken breast, sauces, and arugula between the bagel slices. The details don't do justice in how actually tasteful it was! My traveling companion had one of their burgers and it was equally, maybe even more, flavorful.  They have a great selections of beers and other spirits, above which I expected. I tried the Industry copper ale and it was a pretty tastey amber ale.  All above things are great, however I did say a reserved 4 stars. The service was a somewhat disappointing. I would be more pleased if the service team showed more enthusiasm and not so distracted by other priorities. But it's really the food, drink, and ambience that makes this place special.

lPMx4bD3kG9QTG4YJGDHwQ.text: This restaurant has some of the worst service I have ever experienced. We sat at the bar on a Friday night and it was busy, but not overwhelming. We were there for 1 hour and a bartender made eye contact with us maybe once. We were hungry but could not draw attention for a drink yet alone food. I asked for a sample of a beer on tap which I received but then the bartender just never came back. We waited another 15 mins and called for our tab. Save your time and check out one of the other local, trendy spots in the Robison area.

qM4yXuvWHOaN1jdztfy4Xw.text: Large selection of alcohol and fantastic food. A place you can go to have a few drinks and watch the game in an environment that isn't too bar-like. Also they have giant hot pretzels.

W4d_gZDHYTVV9k3yvse5wA.text: Start off to a poor start when waiting 5 minutes for a hostess on a slow afternoon. Bar staff could care less that guests were waiting. Hostess threw menus on table and said "enjoy" with a snarky attitude. Slow service. Over priced mediocre food lacking basic seasoning.

py0ws3Jea69jbxZvfzQpxQ.text: Relied on Yelp to find this place while in town for business. I went a little before the dinner rush and was sat quickly. I only had a beer or two but really liked their selection. I has a couple of appetizers as my main course but really liked what I had. I could see this being a really cool place to hang out regularly. The atmosphere was really cool and quite a stand out in all of the business travel I do.

SJMkJv4-xZIw2QmAk6u9jQ.text: Date night at Industry Public House in Robinson and decided to go with garlic parm wings.  Wish there was more sauce but the wings were a decent size, maybe a little too overdone.  Nothing on the menu appealed to me that much that evening but it could've been my mood/hunger level.    It was busy and filled with youngish folks when we arrived.  Seemed spacious and wouldn't mind going back when I'm a bit more hungry and adventurous to try something else.

IPzv_ehKkVbUptoWll8HcQ.text: I'm glad I don't have to drive to lawrenceville to enjoy Industry.  This place has a pretty extensive beer collection... And their smoke stacks are delicious. I have only had their HH food, so I can't comment or recommend too much on the food menu.   Only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars is the slight annoyance of the beer list being inaccurate. There are 2 lists: one in paper format, and one on the TV. Good news: They're both numbered. Bad news: it doesn't mean anything and they aren't numbered the same.... Lol. Slightly confusing.

WsWNfFa_SbBO_DRCy2LG7w.text: Excellent food and atmosphere! Friendly service! The pulled pork was delicious. They even had birch beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HgIKaNVBWTr3TX1L9qeMVw.text: This place is the bomb! My husband and I will definitely be back like tomorrow. The atmosphere is super fun, and the food is great. I recommend the pulled pork nachos for an appetizer, and Arsenal Chicken Salad as an entree! I thought it was absolutely delicious. PLUS the portion sizes were huge. Luckily there was so much food, I have lunch for tomorrow! Also - a quick shout out to our server Macy! She provided us with prompt, friendly service, and she was excellent! I can't wait to go back!! Way to go IPH!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wFVpgMuuaryGmhAVXJi1sg.text: Industry is best known for its large selection of draft beers. The food is pub style American and good for a night out. The truffle fries are amazing and the Arsenal chicken salad is my go to Pittsburgh style salad.

dDAQshBbZC5_5O2wzIOjIg.text: Great place, service, atmosphere. Got the fish & chips with an upgraded side of fries with the blue cheese and white truffle oil. Normally I don't even care for fried fish but I saw someone else's and decided to try it out.. and it was amazing. Only thing was that a person at my table got theirs and it was significantly smaller than my fish, so their size was just inconsistent. Other than that the house cocktail sauce on the side was great. Slaw was good too and I never really eat that either.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish &amp; Chips with slaw + upgraded side of the blue cheese / white truffle oil fries.

8fDQnonP42lGo1NQn74gKg.text: Was surprised  Actually enjoyed this place  Nachos with pulled pork were outstanding  Service was very good also

FJueVmclWWrmEN_cVj038w.text: Not bad. This is a trendy place. They have tons of TV so it'd be awesome to catch a game here. The food is "eclectic". I got the lobster Mac and Cheese--while there were nice, big chunks of lobster...there was no flavor. I'm super cheap and felt like I waisted $18. I'd probably come back if someone else was paying for my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese. Save your money.

s2Z1rAbUP0tcCyn83YE-bw.text: Been to this place many times now, but I'm done. They no longer keep consistent hours, and their beers and food are not up to what they charge. They had improved their cleanliness some (but still slow to bus some tables), and although much of the food is not bad, their burgers are on the dry side, even when medium rare, and the fries are normally soggy. After pushing you to close out early, on an otherwise busy night, some bartenders will now hustle you to leave well before their posted 2 a.m. closing hour (which we rely on in deciding to go there), citing "volume" and confusing last call with closing time (what?). I haven't experienced a more abusive and officious bartender who really doesn't understand his/her business like this in a very long time, and I've seen bad (yes, I have been one in more than one place, thanks). This all suggests this place may be looking to cut corners in other ways, plus growing staff entitlement issues. No thanks.

htb-0hwbq8oq7fntJE0zKQ.text: Terrible customer service. Went to dinner with a friend who had a nut allergy. Spoke with the waitress beforehand to guarantee that they could make the salad nut free and we were assured it could be done. When the salad came out my friend asked AGAIN if the salad was nut free and AGAIN we were assured it was. She starts eating the salad only to find *shocker* A NUT. Luckily her allergy isn't life or death, but to be assured multiple times that it would not contain nuts to then find a nut is unnerving. The waitress apologized multiple times which was nice but then did say she found a nut on the first attempt to make the salad....the manager on the other hand handled the situation TERRIBLY. He brought over a new salad (why would she want that?) and then offered to take the $10 salad off and that was it. He did not offer to take off her appetizer and his apology seemed insincere. After asking we did get our meals for free but the attitudes of the staff (besides the nice waitress) weren't great. Would NOT recommend this restaurant if you have any type of allergy as they don't seem to take the situation seriously.

JXWGtobeve5tP-pAVo-5qg.text: My sister-in-law suggested this restaurant to me.  So after picking out of state family up at the airport, we stopped here for dinner.    It was easy to find and had ample parking.  We got there and it seemed fairly crowded.  After a short wait, our party of 5 was shown to a table on the second floor that overlooked the lower bar area.    The menu had a great many choices.  The giant, soft pretzel was a big hit with all of us   We chose to have the beer cheese to accompany it. The amount given seems not enough for such a big pretzel and we had to ask for another. It came with no problem.  My burger was done perfectly and had a side of fries.  Everyone was pleased with their food and the portions were very generous.    Our server was attentive and available for any requests.  A nice variety of beers to chose to go with your meal.   The only issue we had was the noise level that came from the first floor.  It was very difficult to carry on a conversation. Everyone kept having to repeat themselves several times.  This wasn't a deal breaker as we plan on returning next time in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reuben and fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Entry level burger with fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Giant soft pretzel

Jp6OetMd_GvAI_op8_oqag.text: From my several experiences here, this place gets a solid 4 based on food (apps only IMO), drinks & service. I frequent this place typically on quiet Sunday nights.. the drinks are great - huge selection of whisky and bourbon for their exclusive "smoke stack" drink, lots of beers on tap, and a variety of house made cocktails. For an appetizer, I always get the boneless chicken wings that have no breading. These have much to do with why I come here in the first place! So amazing and a healthier option than your typical wings. I would loooove to know how to make these bad boys. Cool spot in my book!

3yy1-M7yhMuI5iDndYH3UQ.text: Highly disappointed with their food.   1. Ordered the Fries with truffle and blue cheese. Food looks like someone barf on it, and someone probably did since it taste like puke.   2. Paella was luke warm and very salty.  3. I thought that they will recover with dessert but unfortunately not. Ordered the cobbler with ice cream, and the ice cream looked pathetic. Looks like someone just spooned ice cream and that's it. I ended up ordering  side of ice cream.  The drinks choices are very good number and that's why I'm giving it 2 star. Other than that, the food was sorry and wont recommend this place.  Will not coming back for food!!!

7HdHku3x6-U-ZsjplgVo0Q.text: Pretty standard chain pub as far as atmosphere and offerings, but their beer selection and perfect flatbreads bump them to my go-to spot for a drink and apps with friends or out-of-towners. Extra bonus points for the great view of the hills from the outdoor seating.

fL-y16TN5SJZdii4Ke6Btg.text: Love coming to this location for the food and service! They have a great selection for cider ale, burgers and flatbreads.

vmNFxme2Y3CuuzM1FX9o_g.text: I wish I didn't have to give any stars. Absolutely horrible experience. The waitress didn't seem to have time for us... Running off every chance she had and never took the menus. The food is alright, but the loud noisy atmosphere, the absolutely disgusting restrooms, and the horrid service put this on my "never coming back" list.

Ul6DhigmG6ImhimUmAJz_g.text: Arriving on a Tuesday at "social hour" time which is 5-7. There were. 3 people working the front. We stood there for several minutes before my husband had to say " hello" and ask for a table.  The decor looks cool, but it isn't functional. I'm not a small person, but I'm not like 300 lbs either. The chairs are very uncomfortable. Even with a handful of people there it was extremely loud. We waited over 10 min to have our drink order taken, a woman at the table adjacent to us up and left for lack of service. I got the workers, their house  burger. It was bland, dry and over cooked for "medium". The caramelized onions were the only thing giving it flavor. Fries are just, well, basic fries.  The prices for food and alcohol are outrageous for what you get.  Just another basic gastro pub style trendy place with sub par food and service. Want a burger, go to 5 guys...

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Workers burger

ZuqdSdSt-TAGne7YKTv7Pw.text: My trip was in June 2, 2019. I was sitting at the bar with a couple of friends. We had one beer that was served by the waitress. That was the last beer we were served at this establishment on this date. Our waitress talked to others at the bar all night and we didn't see another beer until we made it home. This was the worst experience at a bar I've ever had. I won't return

bNvPYsjc5j6DR6b3_OK_Jw.text: Everytime I go to industry public house I'm met with excellent service and even better food. Tons of beer on tap with the option to take growlers home is super nice! I always opt to get the pot roast and it is always amazing. Plenty of food for the money spent. I would consider this one of my favorite places to eat!!

rfGgG0OnkoY_3gSNLIxcHA.text: Stopped in after pick-up at the airport. Nice atmosphere...sat outside, so a little loud but it was a great day.  Service was slow at best.  Waiter was friendly, but each item seemed to take a long time to show up.  Tuna appetizer was good, but it took more than 15 minutes to show up.  Note that it is not cooked.  Entrees (Chicken and Tacos), took another 40 minutes and were cold when they got to the table.  Drink orders also took too long.  Disappointing because the food would have been good (if it was warm) and the beer list is intriguing.  Can't see a reason to go back....

_HbaRJpllTM3-c2VcyNF-w.text: Been here a few times and it's a decent option for the area. We've tried a few burgers and sides. Glad they offer gluten free options and they were decent. A bit pricey for the quality but we enjoyed it enough to return .

wSrds_RPz43BQPypPPVaBg.text: Horrible service.  I go back to this place again and again because of the beer list but I think I'm done.   Service is so bad every time a go and tonight was no exception. Our server didn't bring menus so I had to get them then it took her forever to get our drinks, After that we took our order we never saw her again until she brought up the food every order was wrong as we asked her to correct it that took even longer to the point were most of the Food was cold.   Hopefully this will help

0bGg9IUq0cVDug4io99NMw.text: My wife and I have eaten at Industry a number of times and it has become one of our favorite spots for good food and drinks. The interior design is very industrial (no surprise there) and eclectic. Very cool atmosphere and the place is massive so we've rarely had to wait. There are a ton of TVs so it's a good place to go during a sporting event. The draft beer list is huge and there are also a number of whiskeys to choose from. Everything we've eaten has been delicious. I'd recommend any of the burgers, the pot roast, and the mozzarella cogs as a starter.

RWvtBKwaD2CcVz_bw-jmhQ.text: We arrived at 630 on a Friday night and had an hour wait. However, all of the beers we tried were very tasty. French fries are delicious-the smokestack sandwich is one to definitely try! Don't go with the Pulled pork sandwich-they go heavy on the onion straws and not the pork. Service is just okay...it's a very busy place so that's understandable. Very LOUD music, hard to hear anyone across the table from you without yelling!!

UzrnivrbPDJ_pAn_3gjbrQ.text: I love the bar here because I am a whiskey lover. Lots of options. Ask for Matt at the bar and order a "Smokestack". Unforgettable. Matt is very knowledgeable about whiskies and beers and is an EXCELLENT bartender.

30d2pUZ_MFxXwuhacuOsGA.text: First time here and all I can say is... WOW. Right off the bat, the atmosphere was so laid back and the lighting created a great mood. The inside of the restaurant is almost all wood and has a rustic feel to it. Service was amazing and our food was out so fast! I chose the Eliza chicken and chose fries as my side. The appearance of the food was great and the fries.... oh my goodness. I have never had such good fries. They are the perfect temperature, crunch (but not too crunchy), and soft (but not mushy). Absolutely loved everything about my first visit! Will definitely be coming back

rWrv-gClhd6_a8OiOtHZMA.text: Horrible service. They acted like we were putting them out by asking for a table near a tv so we could watch a game.  Our waitress Lisa then chose to ignore the woman at the table and only come around when the guys had empty beers.  Her tip will reflect the lack of service.

uAL4sJh1LmU4eNyqLfzflQ.text: The food was excellent. They have many different options and it's priced well. We will definitely come back for brunch ASAP.

gCmEDFkFoxIiWg6pCPTD5Q.text: My wife and I were out for the afternoon, looking for lunch, and wondered if Don Pablo's was still here.  We pulled in to see it was a new place and decided to give it a try.  Immediately saw that Industry has a nice atmosphere, and a unique theme (circa prohibition).  Service was immediate, and they had a great selection of beers and whiskey.  My wife wasn't sure which was which, and it's a great option that they offer up to three beer samples!  The menus were unique and offered a decent variety, although perhaps a little too clever for someone just looking a standard burger.  We ordered a nachos appetizer which arrived a little burnt, but oh well, just pick around the burnt chips, right?  But then our main courses arrived within 5 minutes of receiving the appetizer, which is a bad timing issue they'll need to work out.  Having both arrive that soon apart means you have to decide which to eat before something goes cold.  My wife barely touched her chicken salad, later opting to box it to avoid wasting the appetizer.  That should never happen.  My burger was okay, but some of the toppings were burnt, as were the fries, which appeared to be just the crispy remnants at the bottom of the bin.  I had to borrow ketchup from another table, as the service was a bit lax, which I suppose is to be expected with a new place.  Besides these things, I had hoped that maybe just digging into a good burger with barbecue sauce would save lunch for me.  Unfortunately, even the barbecue sauce was weirdly sour as opposed to tangy or sweet.  The manager swung by with the standard inquiry, and we only mentioned the meals coming right after the appetizer.  She offered us a "friends and family" discount, which was honestly appropriate.  Unfortunately, we weren't pleased enough to recommend Industry Public House to our friends and family...or to Yelp.

va4TcFd79KVf2z5uds3JZg.text: what a great place!  the beer selection was great! the food taste and portions  were great! the prices were great! and our server daniel was great! he  explained everything and gave us samples. he was fast and got everyone's order correct. it was a joy to be served by him. we would go back again, if we didn't live in southern california.

cmC6FTbsh-zLKUW2-jbweQ.text: Food was excellent.  Ambiance, outstanding.  Once we were served our server was fabulous.  Only one problem, it took a good twenty minutes to get served.  There were easily ten servers standing around and talking in the empty restaurant but no one waiting on us or acknowledging us.  When a gentleman server (who hadn't previously seen us) was finally notified we needed help (after we inquired if someone could help us--a request that 4-5 servers just standing there heard, causing them to look at me like I had five heads), he was wonderful, obviously frustrated by the situation.  Ordinarily I wouldn't have an issue with the first part because I don't think the hostess told anyone.    Mistakes happen.  It's the part where I kindly request a server and was met with a "how dare you ask that" attitude.  5-10 minutes later they sent someone over to help us.  The server we got was great, though.

0uvzzbgrmwdQQwItysb_og.text: Not impressed what so ever. We were looking for somewhere new to try for a burger and this ISNT the place. Asked for medium well and it was REALLY WELL DONE. Too over priced...we won't be back. Menu not impressive either.

2LebELqOF3FSDpxuLhqHjA.text: Went there today for a second time, first time was in April and it was delicious and the service was top notch,  not so good today. The service was terrible and the food mediocre at best..  Got the Factory fried chicken sandwich, overdone and very salty.  There was a microscopic drop of tomato something or other on it, very dry.  Other person with me got the Industry pot roast and was quite happy with it.  Had the nachos for an appetizer, got then rather quickly and then 5 minutes later our food came, didn't really have time to eat or enjoy the nachos.  Very poor timing on the waitresses part, but oh wait, she only came around every 20 min or so, so how would she know?  As we walked in, the place really wasn't that busy, saw no one inside, except at the bar, most were eating outside.  As we waited for the hostess to decide where to seat us, another couple walked out because they were tired of waiting for service outside, we,of course, chose to sit outside, in hindsight we should have followed that couple out the door and went to eat somewhere else!  Very disappointing..

oy4UrX8pQTbSy9MlnfiMwQ.text: Filet salad is great! Awesome beer selection. We're out of a few things but the waitress showed us some similar new ones! Great pick!

CWcKjQC447Fy2PvWYU0QCg.text: I was here about a week ago for lunch and was really surprised about how good it was. I have never been to an industry public house so I wanted to check it out. First the decor was perfect. I loved the industrial look they had going (suits the name). I got the smoke stack which was good but what stood out were the pot roast fries. They didn't just top the fries with a few pieces of pot roast and drizzle some gravy on top they poured the toppings on. They also have 60 beers on tap which is a dream to all craft beer lovers. I would have to say that the best thing about this restaurant was the server. I really wish I remembered his name. We were in on a Monday afternoon around 2. He has long hair and a beard. Was some of the best service I've gotten from a restaurant. He was recommending beers and telling us about the restaurant. I would definitely come back to this place.

fWh1FznVqVt3u_6_MGdixg.text: Food is amazing!! Excellent beer selection. Service was quick and super friendly! Defiantly an easy decision for dinner if I'm out in the Robinson area.

f2hXq9ODBAicagVIc65KvQ.text: Cool place with good food, around 60 beers on tap and a great stock of whiskeys (at least 50+, which is what tipped my review from 3 to 4 stars. It was packed on a Friday night but we got a table for four in only about 15 minutes. Service was friendly and above average. We tried the truffle fries which were smothered with bleu cheese as well as the mozzarella cogs and both were pretty decent. My "worker" burger was cooked correctly (medium rare) and the Mac n cheese was just alright. My date said her flatbread was delicious. The menu is pretty limited, with mostly burgers, apps, sandwiches and couple of main entrees which they call "sustenance", but I really dig the smaller "gastropub" menu. The entire restaurant gets really noisy, and conversation was difficult, even with the person sitting right next to me. The food probably won't blow you away, but it probably won't disappoint either. Just leave your redneck-love of all things Anheuser-Busch at home, because you won't find any of it here, which in my book is a great thing. I dig a Bud occasionally (see profile pic), but come on, we're living in the golden age of suds and it's a freakin' great time to be a beer lover. Overall it was a positive experience and I'd definitely go here again.

EzsCuueUNwiNBWb2vQ9Feg.text: Great place for happy hour or for an anniversary lunch with coworkers. Great location to see parts of the PGH airshow over the summer.

_Pypy886tuZT3yMvZ-wXIA.text: I think the atmosphere is very neat. The food is overpriced. I ordered the chicken sandwich and it was spicy but not worth the price. I also was not a fan of The Brussels spourts. They were over cooked and too cheesy.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hQW83mkAU-MVV5g4Rp2BDg.text: We were sat at our table and told our waitress would be right with us.  After 15-20 minutes I had to go to the hostess stand to ask if anyone would be waiting on us, or if we should just sit at the bar.  The hostess was not very pleasant and seemed bothered to even be questioned.  Our waitress finally came over where she took our orders, with minor adjustments.  One of us asked her about the turkey sandwich, and if it was carved or sliced turkey.  After being told about it, she decided to go with the chicken salad sandwich.  Which our waitress didn't write down any of our orders.  Our food finally came out, soup was missing a spoon.  My side of lettuce and tomato was forgotten, and a turkey sandwich came out instead of the chicken salad sandwich.  I know people make mistakes, but write down an order to make sure it's done right.  Better communication is needed between the staff as to when patrons are sat in their sections.  This was lunch time and was not busy at all.  Greaters/hostesses are supposed to be friendly and welcoming, not angry and bothered when spoke to.  Food was hot and tasty to say the least.  The staff needs a big improvement.

KF-0NDHBEyDYufRDYTpuQg.text: Love this place.    I enjoy IPH and go on a routine basis.   My go-to's are the Mac and Cheese and Pretzel appetizer.  Mac and Cheese - You can get this but also add about anything under the sun.   I enjoy their candied bacon and jalapeno add-ons.  The pretzel comes on a hook in a big twisted knot of dough.     Beers - You can go on a little adventure since they have many beers on tap.    My only knock is that it can be very loud.   The restaurant has a lot of hard services and high ceilings which creates an echo affect during Happy Hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac and Cheese with chicken, candied bacon, and Jalapeno

LVXSQUMIXnAlMKBdO4pU7Q.text: This was my first time at IPH. I'm from out-of-town and am here on business. I came with a group of coworkers because we had heard good things about this place. When we arrived we noticed it was packed out, which is usually a good sign.  The building itself is really rustic and trendy. It has a divey feel to it and has a lot of great areas for large or private parties. I was in love with the layout and overall space and decor.  They have a pretty short menu, but have a solid group of burgers, sandwiches and other platters, like Fish & Chips. It's a good beer-with-food kind of place. They have a bunch of specialty drinks as well as an extensive number of beers on tap.   I ordered their classic burger which I enjoyed and thought was good. It was hearty, fresh and was a plenty big portion. Most of my companions were satisfied with their meals, expect one friend who ordered their boneless wings. There didn't seem to be anything special about the platter and she seemed less than excited about it.   I'm actually struggling between giving 4 stars or only 3; mainly because we weren't thrilled with our service. Our server must have been having a bad day, but seemed curt and abrupt. She seemed bothered and it made us feel uncomfortable to ask for things. She did the minimum to serve us.   In the end, I'll go ahead and give 4 stars because for the most part, we were all satisfied with our meals. The service just wasn't great.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Entry level burger with fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2GEn22ObDfh0-UgbBCZPAg.text: As someone who works in the service industry, I can almost always understand the back end of what might be causing less than average service. However, my experience at Industry in Robinson was so horrific I am literally warning people not to go to this location.  My husband and I were at the mall and STARVING so we thought we'd try Industry again (we went several years ago and couldn't remember why we never went back). We were sat at a table in the bar area for 10 minutes with no one greeting us or even saying they would be back to take care of us. We moved to sit at the bar and again sat for over 5 minutes before being semi acknowledged- the bartender was picking up all of his tip receipts (literally right in front of us as we took a previous guest's spot after they closed their check) and checking out what he was tipped, ringing in his tips, organizing random things, etc before even saying hello. A guest next to us was very unhappily sending back his cold food, which should have clued us to just have 1 beer then leave. Unfortunately we didn't. We ordered nachos as an app, a chicken sandwich, and a Caesar salad. The food took an insane amount of time to come out and no reasoning or apology was ever offered to explain what the hold up was. Remember the man who was sending his fish tacos back when we sat down? He got a new set of tacos and ate his whole meal before we even got our app. As we were waiting we also heard another customer demand to speak to a manager about their experience. The nachos eventually came out with our meals and when I say they were rock hard, I mean you couldn't even pull a chip out because they were sitting under the heat lamp so long the cheese hardened into a mountain of brown disgusting shit. They put some cold sour cream and guacamole on top to pass it off as fresh. I would have sent them back, but the bartender was no where to be found and never came to check on us after someone else delivered our food. I had to flag down another server because my husbands salad had no dressing on it- just a bowl of romaine lettuce with a chicken breast on top. Our beers sat empty for half of our meal and no one was around to ask if we'd like another or even offer us water. The one redeeming quality was that my hot chicken sandwich was good and they have delicious fries, but there is nothing else positive I could say about our experience. The staff is unfriendly and have zero people skills, it is dark as hell and as a 28 year old with perfect vision I could barely read the menu, and the management is clearly complacent and asleep at the wheel if they think their restaurant is doing well. As I said, being in the service industry something would have to be SO awful for me to ever write a review like this, but this place pushed me there. I can't recommend enough that you NEVER go here and save your hard earned money to be spent somewhere that actually deserves it. As I said, we are going out of our way to warn people about how awful our experience was so please save yourself the headache and look elsewhere.

3s_zORclbXGAT-EAvyrVIA.text: Although they do have a nice selection of alcohol it seemed a bit overpriced for what it was. We both got burgers & a side of the Mac & Cheese & it was okay. The buns on the burgers were too crumbly & fell apart & also had a lack of any flavor they were disappointing as well as the patty itself. We got the candied bacon for an appetizer & it was $10 for 5 pieces of bacon that was hard to even chew. Meh. The flight of drinks we ordered was great, our server was really helpful, nice & on top of her game. Just wish the food was better.

NtLuC7LaO_tkVvLxaXkxEg.text: The food was good and portions were huge. I got the pulled pork Mac and cheese and you could have fed a family with the portion size. My husband got a Rueben and that again was huge. We had leftovers for two meals.

AV7F9cG0CkASi222Ts4Wew.text: Love the atmosphere!  The beer section is pretty good and the outside area is really cool!

aa5XsZso1xaRwfd-UL_8Vg.text: Very possibly the best burger I've had. I order the Farmed out Burgher cooked medium well and it was exactly that. The wild boar bacon was smokey and delicious.  Come with plenty of homemade fries that are also delicious.  Had a few drinks that are very reasonably priced and I tried their in house IPA which was pretty good.   The service was also solid. It was slightly busy but I was greeted promptly and served a drink in a good amount of time. They recommended the beer and described it well.   As I'm here just for work not sure if all make it back but if I'm in the area again I would definitely stop here again.

UUh7jU6OpCyBgypC_bWOqg.text: I've stopped in 2 times now and both times I've had to get the same thing. Every time I tell myself I'll get the nachos or try something new since it all looks so good but I just can't. The chicken on the President's salad (caesar salad) is just out of this world. It is seasoned so perfectly with cajun seasoning. It's not too salty or too spicy. Something about it just goes so well with the caesar salad. My boyfriend tried it this last time and he said he would definitely order it the next time.  The drink options are excellent and they have something for everyone. They have multiple beers, ciders, etc on tap. Everyone is likely to find something for them. If not they have some mixed drinks that also look fairly good. I unfortunately haven't tried any of them yet but their sangria was delicious.  The only reason I can't give this place a 5 star is because it's overly crowded. Both times I was seated at a high table by the bar and both times it was during happy hour. The crowd was very large at the bar and I felt like I was basically sitting with the people at the table next to me because we are so close together.

AzEQTs6Awy9utg4PdhIvmA.text: I love this bar. With a lot of local beers and national seasonal and speciality choices on tap, there is much to keep a craft snob interested ad coming back. The Smokestack, smoke infused bourbon or rye, was a thing of art and fun to watch being prepared. The bar staff was super attentive and friendly.  My Reuben was a little disappointing. The house made corned beef was quite good and much better than typical lunch meat corned beef. That is where the sandwich stopped exceeding my expectations. I found there to be too little corned beef and the rest of the sandwich was had typical diner ingredients: standard pre-sliced marble rye that was lightly toasted, not grilled, making it flabby; the sauerkraut and cheese were nothing special. I was expecting more elevated gastro-pub food with a pile of meat for the price.  I am local and look forward to trying something else in the near future. I would definitely come back for drinks.

xseTL_QcUpzhZ9rCohEqsA.text: Good drinks Good food It's just really pricey.  Not worth the money.  I'd rather eat at a Steakhouse.  It's better and cheaper.

BPaQS4tCNQV34WballcEEQ.text: I absolutely loved the food here. They have a great assortment of food (mostly sandwiches) as well as a great beer menu. I got the smoke stack. It was absolutely delicious the portion size was good and tasted delicious. The side I got was sweet potato fries which was equally delicious. They put cinnamon and sugar on them so be aware of that but it is quite tasty.   For dessert I order the ice cream sandwich. There are a variety of flavors for the cookie as well as the ice cream. Definitely save room for dessert. Price wise it's pretty comparable to any restaurant you'll eat at in robinson.   My gf and I got an app both had a sandwich and upgraded our sides and I got a dessert. Total cost was just over $50.   The server we had was very attentive and was very helpful with ordering. I definitely would recommend trying this restaurant out if you haven't tried it yet.

6oJvoAQlJmbf-bF4DVNMXw.text: Amazing brewery/ bar. Awesome mix of music on. Amazing service, never had a bad meal here in the past 13 times I have been here. Fair prices! Best Mac & Cheese in the Burgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sorry ate the assembly line Mac and cheese! Best in the Burgh!! Service is amazing!!

HVgq_IOjyBYiXzjIxGsjMw.text: Best nachos around and an amazing outdoor patio area.

vIKaFMOZ5gw2lTler0Ulbg.text: Let me start by saying I'm not a big drinker so this review relates mostly to the food. The interior is very welcoming and relaxed.  I could see this place filling up for major sporting events.  The bar area is huge. We were out shopping and just wanted a bite for lunch, something light.  HA wrong place for that.  As soon as we saw the pretzel with beer cheese on the menu we had to try it.  HUGE! It was good, really good, but overpriced at $15. I had the grilled chicken salad with ranch dressing.  The dressing really had no distinct flavor at all, but the veggies were fresh and chicken was cooked perfectly. My mom opted for the pot roast fries and again the portion size was enough for  family of 6 to share.  I'd say this is a great place for a large group to order a couple of items to share.  Make sure you are starving when you go!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled chicken (it&#39;s under all the cheese) salad
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $15 pretzel

kaxPnN1CVa_VyH3VYlfS3Q.text: Updated review: the menu is definitely getting a lot better.  They have expanded their selection since the very first time I went.  The flatbreads, Mac and cheese, and fries are my go to.  They have so many beers, and I feel like the options are presented well (both on a TV screen and on the menu).  They have a happy hour which is pretty good and it's always a good time.  The service isn't the best I've ever had, but I haven't had a bad experience here.  I would recommend!

T2wFHMt-bfqE7FPFpQgSkA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in the Robinson area! We are gluten free and absolutely love the sandwiches here. Bbq pork is my favorite and Rueben is my husband's. Also our friends say the Mac n cheese is amazing!

QlnKB4JnlWjvQ9KQr1ZnCA.text: No no no no , this place , chili's, cheddars, are all the same . I've had much better in the chow hall on base.

F2VAK1-Dhkx1hOw047XUWQ.text: I've been there a few times since they opened and have never been disappointed in the food. I'm a fan of the boneless "wings" (which are more like the chicken you get in a dish at a Chinese restaurant) especially with the hot parm sauce! The smokestacks are great and the smell of the Burning wood fills the place sometimes on busy nights but I love that smell so it doesn't bother me. The only bad thing for me is the staff can be hit or miss. I've had great bartenders there, I've had some that definitely make you feel like you're somehow interrupting their day. It can get sort of a hipstery vibe which can be good or bad. Overall, this is my go-to place with a much better beer selection and drastically better prices than Bocktown in my experience. Glad they came to the area!

zonLXiekWA6_8pt2CjB7Rw.text: Decided to try it on a whim and glad we did.  Burgers are huge and very good.  My daughter wasn't in to the loaded burger and found out they have a "social burger ".  Pretty much standard burger.  Wife had the fish sandwich and it too was huge and delicious.   Fries are excellnt.  Will be back to try the huge selection on tap!

VpUTm4ebaNeUfKq65v0CRg.text: Fish was over cooked and beer batter was tough.  Service not great.  I wouldn't return. Though nice ambiance/ place.

PxQDJ5xfAPJi3S5ngrHbtw.text: Was my first visit. A Friday afternoon for lunch. I got the Cajun chicken salad - forget what it was called (the President).  Salad was great, very good portion but the chicken was terribly over seasoned. Tasted like a salt lick, really. The chicken itself was good but they used an incredible amount of seasoning that made it less than enjoyable. Was close to inedible. I'd give 2-3 stars but it was a good atmosphere, friendly staff & it looked like it has potential. I wouldn't hesitate to go back for a second try.

iO-uzfOc3olKWWfvvAbiuw.text: Food was fantastic! We sat outside which overlooked a gorgeous valley while watching planes overhead. We ate the mozzarella cogs, which were delicious but we're very pricey, $10 for 5 small cogs.  Nachos were wonderful, very fresh and fresh jalapenos thinly sliced throughout the dish.  Arsenal ribs with French fries were wonderful. Steak sandwich well seasoned and well executed and macaroni and cheese was enormous and divine. Music is too loud but we would definitely go here again.  The steak that came with the macaroni and cheese didn't have much seasoning but it was meant to be mixed in with the macaroni and cheese.  Coleslaw was fresh but I could taste too much celery seed.  Pickle spear that came with steak sandwich was sweet. We are not a fan of sweet pickles. Very fresh and well prepared food.

T6YCqG7E3f5hjN8XJoftZg.text: Zero is what this place deserves. We waited 30 minutes and saw many unseated tables. After waiting the 30 minutes and before seating us, the hostess warned us food would be delayed after we ordered due to party of 32 who had just ordered. Then after seating us, waitress told us it would be 45 minutes until we would receive food. It's a crime we waited for 30 minutes only to be told then it would be another 45 minutes until we received food. Don't book large parties if you can't handle the load.

R-DQAuza0KMcbiVKBGMysw.text: I went here a while back when I first noticed the place had opened. I had a couple beers and a hamburger that was just okay. I went back yesterday for lunch and a Pittsburgh Craft Beer Week event (Green Flash Tap Takeover) and had a turkey sandwich. The food, service, and beer were amazing. These guys won me over yesterday. I'll definitely be going back.

98TZL4SKpwZjEbZuMewwsA.text: We ate here for brunch on a Sunday morning. We were one of about 3 tables. We were greeted and seated immediately. We ordered the corn beef hash and biscuits and gravy. Our food was brought out to  us FREEZING. Like, nothing was hot at all or even warm. It tasted like it was refrigerated without throwing it in the microwave. The cubes of beef in the corned beef hash were too big and chewy.  What's disappointing is that it had really good hollandaise sauce. We definitely will never be back.

P5dSvJ6qOhaLjFRuaDgGUQ.text: The food was excellent!!! The selection of whiskey and draft beer is amazing. I would highly recommend checking it out. That is if you a beer, bacon, and burger fan!

znDZbm_i74GYistjTGU4bg.text: If you're scared off by overpriced food, Industry's  "social" hour is your oasis. There's a $6 "burgher" that goes up in price as you add accoutrements, but just indulge already. Of the several $7 flatbread options, the 'shroom is my jam (and the only one I've tried). The $6 chili cheese fries had such potential, but hope was dashed by the bottom-of-the-barrel fry basket I was presented with. I meannnnn, I can only eat so many burnt nubbins before I just want one (just one!) normal, fresh cut fry. We got what we paid for I suppose. Let's not forget the beer FTW though! The long tap list, which doesn't make a joint unique almost anymore these days, is still a highlight at Industry with its eclectic mix of styles and breweries near and far. Lastly, service was great despite the post work frenzy and FWIW their interior design was one of the first vintage, industrial done right designs in the 'burgh (Larryville).

cOkOBTuXb4Ta_3myUyCjgQ.text: Interesting atmosphere. Loud and not great for conversation. Skip it for a date. Food was 'meh'. I think they have a moral issue with salt. Everything needed salt. EVERYTHING! Might be okay for a happy hour but I would avoid for a nice dinner. Hubby - Man said the pot roast was good. They had Cholula; that's why they get 3 stars. I think it needed salt. :-)

2QcuQVpk1uhxkiepvBG_2g.text: Went to dinner this past week and had a very good experience! Our server, I can't think of his name but he was very friendly and attentive! Food didn't take to long and it was delicious. Overall, we had a great time and can't wait to go back!

dR2f1IdNvpwgX_pk4g1VFg.text: We went for lunch on a Sunday and we were surprised it wasn't more crowded, given how many people were out and about shopping in Robinson.  I was less surprised after we had our meal, however.  The food was mediocre to good (I had mac & cheese which was a huge amount of food but so dull and boring; hubby had a burger and fries which he loved).  Service was fast enough but perfunctory.  Two examples:  1) when we walked in, we heard screaming children (a surprise since the music was very loud) and asked to be seated anywhere but near the screaming child.  The host promptly walked us back to a table right next to two, count 'em two, screaming children!  And then looked surprised when we didn't want to sit there; 2) my husband ordered a meal which came with fries - we had to call the server back to get ketchup.  We expressed an interest in dessert, even though we weren't asked if we'd like some (no attempt to upsell), but then the server brought the check instead of the menu.  Better training would benefit this place a lot.  And my leftover mac & cheese was a lot better after I added to it and cooked it properly at home.

IJ1UyQe7YiNlkxNaMWHmfA.text: So, this is not quite the same Industry as the one in beloved Lawerencville, but it is a great beer centric establishemnt for the Robinson area. Plenty of TV's to catch a game and a hang out with some friends.

Mev7mQOgYKlqerMs7ktqsg.text: I was eager to visit Industry, since hearing of it from a coworker.  I visited this location for lunch, before they got busy and crowded. I'm not one to pick, but the service was really lacking.  For there being so few people in the restaurant, when I visited, the wait to be served... a drink, let alone the food was extreme... and I'm a very patient & understanding person.  The food itself was OK, I had the Falafel Wrap.  Industry does look like a good place to go with friends for drinks.  Looks like they're doing some creative things with their drinks.  I'll probably stop back in to give them another try.

9bTFInLf0pqB_0NXUpzq3w.text: Great draft beer selection.  Food is good, atmosphere is nice. & employees are friendly.  You won't be disappointed coming here for drinks or a meal.

OMDZX5I4WSW2_4ix9I136Q.text: Definitely way too loud to be carrying on conversation with the rest of your party. I've never been a fan of the drinks since I tend to go with sweeter ones and the restaurant doesn't seem to have anything. Will normally only go for appetizers which are all definitely worth the price

58gsjbq3og-wu0YL6Pqa5g.text: I have a new place for Happy Hour :)  Terrific beer menu with something for everyone, all displayed on a series of monitors (they even show how close a keg is to being kicked).  I sampled a cheeseburger and the tomato/mozzarella flatbread, and both were very good. Happy Hour price of $5 make either a must-have with drinks.  Also sampled one of the "Smokestack" whiskey drinks - essentially a take on an old fashioned, but with your choice of a LONG list of whiskeys and maple syrup. The kicker? It's poured through charred wood of your choice (I tried the cherry), giving the drink a smoothness and smokey flavor that was unlike anything I'd had before. I'll go back for this drink, for sure.  Excited to try this place again soon!

6vw54dfrGNTQG4UCsEy6iA.text: Great atmosphere. Bartenders are very attentive. Arsenal hard cider is delicious. Haven't tried the food.

H5NeHQMmMszer4-HMJ1v9Q.text: I've been to Industry twice. Both times the service was great and the food was delicious! As I work nearby, I wish they had a better selection for the $5 happy hour special. Overall I give this place a thumbs up and will be returning for the food.

MErt8-nbm5Z5ACUF8sZy5Q.text: Nice atmosphere and really good service.  They deserve this solid 4 stars.  I took a star off for the way they f'n butchered biscuits and gravy.  The biscuits were hard and flat (pieces flew into my lap when trying to break a piece off) and they added red bell pepper to the gravy.  It was so off-putting that I wrote this review just as a warning to others that may want to order them.  Some things aren't meant to be "elevated," and biscuits and gravy is one of them I guess.

2Vw1pClhHde8InhRGD0lOw.text: My husband and I have been to Industry multiple times and a much as it pains me to say it: all things considered, it's just average.   Food: is either on point or lacking. We vary between getting our usual favorites or trying something new and no matter what, it's hit or miss. The same meal will be amazing one day and just average the next. I will say that I have only been disappointed with their 9th Ward Salad (IMO the best thing on their menu) twice. Once because it was over dressed the one time I ordered it at their Lawrenceville location and a second time at Robinson where they forgot the goat cheese (picky, I know but I love me some goat cheese). Other hit and miss faves have been their wings, the roast beef and the fish & chips.  Drinks: great beer list. Cocktails are amazing. The smokestack, arguably my favorite drink and their signature is also hit or miss. Their bartenders/servers are knowledgeable about which whiskeys go well with which wood. How the smokestack is prepared is another story. Bottom line: burn all the freaking wood. Take another 20 seconds to make sure you've lit the whole pire. And then make sure that you've covered the whole damn thing and the smoke is actually getting into the whiskey and not seeping out the shaker. Picky? Again, yes. But this is your SIGNATURE DRINK. Make it perfect EVERY TIME. And honestly, if you can't, don't make it a point to make it in front of me. I AM judging your technique.  Service: is honestly sub par for the quality you'd expect at this calibur of restaurant. Again, hit and miss but almost every server has had their disappointing moments. First was when we were seated and then forgotten about (i.e. our server, who was AWESOME, did not know he was assigned to us and at least four other employees walked by us in 15 minutes and did nothing). Second was just slow service on the floor in general, our server taking the time to get us drinks and put in our food order, but when the food was served we were ignored for quite some time. When we learned our lesson and switched to sitting at the bar it didn't get much better. There have been some stand-out bartenders (read: those who actually do what they are paid to do - be attentive to all their patrons, refill empty beer glasses promptly, and follows up after meals are served) and those who just don't. Like the girl at brunch who spends more time complaining to her co-workers than serving and not noticing the beer that has been empty for 15+ minutes. And another bartender who's attentive until the food comes out and completely forgets to follow up ("how is everything? Do you need anything else?"). Or the other bartender becoming kerfuffled when after ignoring us and finally getting around to us, we get a little snippy with her, and instead of making up for it she goes back to ignoring us to clean glasses at the other side of the bar. Petty of us? Sure. But honestly, all this woman needed to do was touch base when she walked by ("how y'all doing? Can I get you anything?"). I think what it boils down to is the servers are only paying attention (at best) to revenue based services and not the services that make our meal pleasant. For us, if your service is great, regardless of the quality of the food, you'll get a good tip. But hit or miss food, we have not had a reason to tip well for quite some time.  With that all being said, I do enjoy Industry, I really really do. Their beer list is amazing and when their food is good it's incredible. But the service is something I would expect at...I don't know, I'd say Applebee's but they have great service, lol.

vfYmZDN4bG4WnSscCBEL1A.text: Having a family who comes from the serving industry, and owns a local bar/ restaurant of their own... this place had been a mess EVERY time that I'm there. The food is usually decent, but the service is consistently awful.   Today I sat down at the bar for lunch and ordered the chili and a president salad. The bartender took a solid 10 minutes to even roll on by despite the restaurant being empty.  He asked our orders. To which we ordered two beers, two soups, and two president salads (dressing  on the side). The bartender then left and had a conversation with the rest of the staff at the host stand (6-8 of them) while other patrons at the bar looked around and tried to get their attention for service. This went in for another 15 minutes. Not a single employee came by and asked if anyone wanted waters or drink refills, they stood at the host stand while everyone sort of sat in awe at the shit service. Then the food came out. The chicken on the salad was so salty that it was inedible, both salads came drenched in so much dressing despite having asked for one with dressing on the side, the soup was cold. The server never came by to ask if anything was ok. Never came by to ask if we needed refills. Never came by to ask if we needed anything else. Another 15 minutes went by and we flagged the bartender down and asked for our check.   Coming from the service industry, we did not stuff him or make any ridiculous Complaints. But this has now been the 3rd time service has been atrocious and the food had been messed up. Not that one customer matters, but I absolutely will not be back again.   I really hope the GM can re-train their staff or at minimum, hold a meeting to discuss attentiveness and basic skills.   Best of luck

Oh-zUBOOM793cBsr4eZniQ.text: Food is good but service has been TERRIBLE the last couple times we visited. On our most recent visit our waiter lacked urgency and could not handle a small section. I used to waitress believe me. Everyone in his area was trying to get his attention. Very frustrating. Took 20 minutes to take our order and never came back to fill up water or to check on us. Then the waiting game for the check and to close us out. Ugh. Oh and he never told me my side of fries would be ordered as a full appetizer portion.   Industry- please find better wait staff. If your sales are down this is why.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burger and side of mac. Very good!

CBB3UieQ67x_dAsmSo9S0A.text: Came in the other night as kind of a last minute decision because nothing else was open at the time. My boyfriend and I both ordered salads, and they give pretty nice portions.   I think we were looking for more basic menu options, but everything on their menu is sort of fancy, with unique ingredients. I think that's awesome, but I'm not sure if that's what we were in the mood for at that moment.   I love the fact that they have Leona's ice cream sandwiches. They're really tasty, and there's always different flavors at different times of the year. We ordered the cherry vanilla/chocolate chunk & it was gone in like 2 seconds. So tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

m6XnNORw0qYrWtPf1ay-ag.text: One of my favorite locations to go to in all of Pittsburgh. The list of drinks is endless. Allways a new seasonal drinks every time I go. Ask your waiter or bartender what is new. Every employee that I have had there has always been knowledgeable and there recommendations have always been top notch.

DroLoCJoGB5AKZS3UDXtjw.text: Tried once more tonight. Wow, same issues with cold wet fries, cold burger and petrified bun.   Oh, this time we couldn't get served until the waiter showed up at work for our table. What?!?! Back to Burgatory from now on for me. Sad as I am not a big fan of theirs either as they are so overpriced and also almost IPA only.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Petrified bun. Who served this?!?!  Was it Frozen and thawed under water?

_qTCO-xze7bLZYK3tc4BMA.text: Bad. Service is complacent and disinterested. Constant socializing. Nobody behind the bar takes it seriously. Food was below average. Ahi Tuna was weak. Bad choice on my part. Stuffed mushrooms weren't bad but the plate smelled like disinfectant. They need a management intervention.

q69BG_pv2GH96LL0THgVTA.text: Came to industry for dinner on a Saturday evening- was pleasantly surprised that there was no wait. There is a lot of beer options to choose from, and our server brought me some samples to try since I was having a hard time deciding. We had good service throughout our meal. We gad the pork nachos as an appetizer-they were so good- and the portion size is huge. We ended up getting pretty full off of it and split the Mac n cheese with Cajun chicken as a meal. The Mac n cheese was also so good-would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4fwPdlGMjpmWy9yhUp6j7A.text: Huge beer selection with flatscreen TVs all over the place displaying the beers and keg levels. A beer snobs wet dream come True!  It's been a while since I've been to Industry but with my brother and sis-in-law in town and knowing how much they are into beer-centric places like this, I just had to take them here.  We started out with the Candied Bacon and some fries with truffles and blue cheese. Both were good. I had the Assembly Mac and Cheese that I added Pot Roast to. Very good and filling! My wife actually ordered the same thing. My siblings had the fried chicken sandwich which was also large and filling.  All-in-all everything was very good. Food service was very quick!  Watching some other things come out of the kitchen I hope to go back soon and try some other entrees that looked delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

y-TsLBscBgIOmXa9P5H8BA.text: Significant improvement from the last time I ate here a few years ago. My mom and I came for lunch and we definitely enjoyed our meals. Our server Miranda was awesome! She was super friendly and made our experience a great one. The prices for lunch were reasonable since the portions were the perfect size.   For lunch, I had the turkey sandwich on a gluten free bun. I am so thrilled that Industry has gluten free buns now, because it allows me to try other things on their menu besides the salads. For vegan friends, they have impossible burgers now. My turkey sandwich was excellent, the turkey had a nice peppery and smoky taste to it. The toppings were piled generously too, for example, there was a ton of bacon and gruyere cheese on my sandwich. On the side, I decided to try the blue cheese truffle fries because I heard they were delicious. Well that's right! The truffle fries are so yummy. I never thought of blue cheese and french fries being a good combo, but Industry makes it work! The fries are a tad salty, but other than that, they were tasty.   I am very happy that Industry's food quality improved and how they added gluten free/vegan things to the menu. I am also pleased by the outstanding wait staff here and I will certainly be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Handhelds aka sandwiches
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey sandwich on gluten free bun with a side of truffle fries

doiNyqcAE77neJ0jFNZJPQ.text: Stopped in here for lunch with a coworker after an early morning set of flights. We each got a beer and a burger, mine with the brussel sprouts, his with fries, and a side order of their unique bacon. As the name of the restaurant suggests, the interior looks fairly industrial with lots of metal.  Our burgers came out timely and to-order. The meat was juicy and flavorful. The brussels I ordered were resplendent with blue cheese and bacon. There are a number of burger places in and around Pittsburgh, and this one doesn't let you custom build one like others do, but that said, the ingredients they do use are on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gVfJmRCFxjCK-3bzKUAIYA.text: It was a very subpar experience. The menu looks like it has some really unique and great options but after eating the food I was not impressed. The boneless chicken wings looks like leftover cat food and the Brussels sprouts after I already asked "are they roasted" come in this overly salty gravy that did not mesh well flavor wise. The pierogis also do not have any hint of truffle. Wish it was as good as I thought it was going to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

PaCTF_iVIDANLsXmOu7ZPg.text: Very nice place in Robinson Township right of the Parkway.  Atmosphere is casual and relaxed. Full-service bar and outdoor seating as well. Menu was big enough to have choices yet small enough to not be overwhelmed. Appetizers were fantastic, specifically the industrial-sized pretzel and the two house bacon options. Reuben sandwich was very good, fish and chips were excellent and the pierogies were passable.  Wait staff was extremely friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Appetizers

N20AYJiC8QepsICEBvfMYw.text: I'm very impressed with the space at this restaurant. There is a large downstairs dining area, an outside seating area, and additional seating upstairs which our server told me is available for parties. The decor is beautiful, similar to Industry in Lawrenceville but much larger.  Our server was slammed, and we weren't in a hurry - he was still very attentive for the most part and very helpful when it came to selecting our food and beer. A few things, we didn't have silverware and a soup order was forgotten until the main course came out.  My salmon salad was very good. I normally have a negative review towards salads with hardly any toppings (which is what I had) but whatever they seasoned the kale with was unbelievably tasty which is probably why there wasn't much else on the salad.   I would recommend this location for anyone looking for a casual dining experience with a huge beer, wine, and cocktail selection.

3DUUVW0Gjk9Sco6k00SuAA.text: We came here for drinks- fun atmosphere with live music but a little loud and hard to talk with others with us. Good drinks- a little pricey but average bar prices I suppose. We were here from out of town so thanks for a fun night!

htYL69phqAzIoMAQuG7Irg.text: Four reasons I'll never come back:  1) One of my friends was stung by a bee. Inside. And I get it, nature happens, can't control every insect. But the way our waitress handled it, all she said when we told her was "oh. Sorry." And then walked away back to stand with the other servers.   2) The food itself was mediocre for its price. I got the pulled pork, which should've been called a coleslaw sandwich with a side of pulled pork. Barely any meat. On top of that, my food came out cold, along with my two friends. Not even slightly warm, just like they've been sitting around for 20 mins.   3) The wait was awful. We got seated right away, a maybe halfway full restaurant on a Thursday at 6. We got our food maybe at 7:30. My friend went through three beers before we got our food, it was ridiculous, and again our waitress was no help.   4) They can't even serve beer correctly. If you're going to pose as a suedo-hipster bar/restaurant, at least do one thing right. Asked for a draft, they served it to me in a can. Not even a can into a glass, a shaken, foamy, can.   This place is an overpriced, pretentious, bar that doesn't have anything going for it besides it's pretzels, which I'll admit are good, but again, are they $15 good? Used to be a regular, not coming back again.

p_15SGO1KdA5zpr8T2rOaA.text: The Mac and cheese was great, great beer selection, along with a nice assortment of different sandwich and burger choices. This place also had a  cool happy hour and a nice ambience with a staff that is very knowledgeable.

QsIQ942Fn8Ok93Jg5eJfZA.text: IPH currently has the best on tap beer selection in the area.  The printed menus aren't always current but they have real time menus on multiple TVs, their website, and app. Food is pretty good.  I'm a fan of the happy hour specials, especially the buffalo chicken flat bread.  If you really want some comfort food, get the Mac and cheese.. you will not be disappointed! My only complaint is how they seat people.  I have gone on not so crowded nights and got seated uncomfortably close to larger families.  I also took my mom to lunch when it was empty and was seated on the stage... Just so all the bartenders could watch us eat..

i6Ufttk9t1c1lEUkDnGCnQ.text: Very disappointed. Food was average bar food. Very nice beer list but it was in alphabetical order not by beer category which would be nice so you could 'explore' different beers. My daughter had the flat bread...it was ok. We had the fries w truffle oil and blue cheese. Not impressed. Sandwiches were very average although their descriptions were amazing. So loooooud in here. And service was average

qa1uMSv3ynKrZ0JBAQA7ZA.text: I ordered the filament french fries, with truffle oil and bleu cheese. they were delicious! i had wings for my main course, they were delicious as well. highly recommend! great atmosphere.

wf-4cQm3wRAjn7-K6LAK-A.text: Favorite wings in Pittsburgh. Great selection of drinks, fast and friendly service, and a fun atmosphere.

HxmMpW5cJaACbA8JG81JVw.text: The good.....  our server (John P) was very good!  Friendly, efficient., the pot pie and burgers!   The bad... the manger (Frank) tops the list. After a few mishaps, we called for him. My hubby ordered a "flight" of beer. Out of 5 beers, the bartender felt it his duty to exchange 2 of them without asking or even telling us what they were. The manager questioned us about it. My margarita... it arrived with a foreign body in it, two pieces of wood. Wood Chips from another type of drink they make!  The kids chicken fingers... we sent them back twice... yes twice and they were still inedible!    The manager did take the chicken fingers and flight of beer off of our bill. He later returned with a voucher for a free app. We graciously declined as we will never return.   My husband asked for more off of our bill and he agreed. When we received our bill, frank apparently changed his mind as no discount was taken.   We are not ones to complain!  We took our 3 children out to dinner and really hoped for a nice evening and dinner. How very VERY disappointing!   Worth noting, our server John, took a family and friends discount off for us!!

Clc5q_OA-mE_Hy47Xav3Ag.text: Food is really good.  Beer selection is great.  Service is terrible.  Every time I am here the servers are abysmally slow and the last one had an attitude.  Great spot to get a few good beers and again, the food is pretty good.  Just very poor service that hurts the experience.  A LOT of time can go by before you are checked on and wanting another beer - very tempting to not go directly to bar when you are at a table

m87M93_413d6Lsg-oNmWVQ.text: Absolutely enjoyable experience.  The service was quick and courteous, the establishment was clean, and the food was fresh and good.  My only issue was that the fish and chips needed a little salt, as the hater alone didn't have much flavor, and the batter easily separated from the fish.  All in all though, one of the best places I've eaten in the area.

L2V28SVwJsZXLB5Vt8QXvw.text: This was our second visit when in town for a sporting event. We stopped again because we stayed at a local hotel and out last visit was a pretty good one. Our sever John was not there any longer as we were told by our present server that he was fired cause he was a jerk. Really??? We thought he was wonderful and a great server and had a great personality. Our server went on to elaborate that he was fired because he was old, set in his ways and would not do his work. Somehow, my husband and I don't believe that. Compared to this Heather, he was a complete professional Server Heather was a wreck. she ran around like she was lost. forgot our drinks and had to remind her about it. Silverware was dirty and food was greasy and tasteless. I had the smokestack and the bread was sopping wet with butter. not crispy or toasted. We ordered several different beers but was told they were out of each one of them so we opted for iced tea. Needless to say, the next time we come to Pittsburgh for an event, which we do regularly, we will eat at Olive Garden, Max and Ermas or one of the other local restaurants.

_HAoFikYaG2F-FSoIYAz2g.text: I went on a Tuesday afternoon at 1:00 and was very disappointed just meeting with my sister in law we decided to have appetizers I ordered the boar bacon , pot roast fries ,and the shroom flatbread and was very disappointed all three dishes were very bland not just to my taste but also my sister in law's the bacon was warm and under cooked and limp @ $10 for 5 pieces I really wanted to enjoy it but I couldn't . All three dishes seemed like they had no seasonings the drinks may be good but food was definitely not

FtnHsidcCy_TATRsvs4E7A.text: I'm guessing the hick-ups are due to the recent opening.  We went to this restaurant / bar for happy hour this past Friday.The happy hour prices and specials are pretty good. (Half-off taps, $7 Cocktails, cheap burgers). However, our service was less than good. We waiting about 20min+ for each drink. It got to the point sometimes where we just went up to the bar and ordered because our waitress was no where to be found.  They also messed up one of our groups check, by about $20, which was kind of a big deal.  The place does have good food and I've heard the smoked whiskey is very good.  I'd come back in the future just to see how it's doing, will not be a first choice though.

8bHS6MHZwf-fREDhEydQ_g.text: We Go here a lot it's a great atmosphere and the staff are always great. The beer selection is great especially if you like many different beers. The only thing we don't like is the food menu is little limited.

DZ01c02Q4Z6os1qAAWYUBQ.text: I love Industry Public House! A great menu with well executed dishes and an ever changing list of tasty drinks. Relaxed bar area with tons of tv's to watch the games and seating with cozy lighting make this a comfortable place for date nights, family dinners or girls/boys night out. I highly recommend the candied bacon!

hosOLR4Q6X48IONu6w2Hyw.text: The pot roast is amazing. Good choice on cider. Can be very cramped watch the hours on google to see the best time.

aKL0TDs39U_X_tsMKh_j4A.text: Ordered take out about a week ago but didn't get a chance to leave my review. They didn't have much to choose from for vegetarians if you exclude salad. I got the Falafel wrap. It was good but it was spicier than I was expecting and reminded me more of the inside of a samosa than a falafel. I was expecting it to be made from chickpeas. It wasn't bad but I'll probably order something else next time. I know its inevitable but it was soggy when I got home. I just put it in the oven for 5 mins and crisped it back up with my french fries. I'll come back  another time for a dine in experience and try something else. Overall food wasn't bad maybe try dining in.

WSV3fQ15JHr_f2UxoXC7-w.text: Stopped by for dinner recently. Good service. Great selection of draft beer and ciders. Food was good. Definitely will go back. Nice local place that is not part of a national chain. Their house brewed beer is good.

Au3I3kwgH73VuAtJdNs6IQ.text: This place has industrial decor. It is clean and inviting and  well done inside. Staff was very friendly, welcoming  and helpful they really knew the menu and it was  helpful when picking a drink choice our waitress was wonderful. .. sadly I for got her name. Some things on the menu were not appealing to me so I went with the fish n chips... which to my surprise was not a sandwich. It was a large beer battered fillet, with slaw and I opted for the mac n cheese.. the mac and cheese was definitely a good choice. The fish was good as long as you peeled off the extremely greasy breading.  The name of the place also doesn't do it justice. But all and all we had a nice time. They have a huge drink/beer selection. I would be willing to give the fish another try, hopefully the oozing greese will be non existent. Oh and please replace the clip board menu with steel/brass rings instead of a clip, everything kept sliding all over. The food is also a bit over priced, My other half got the presidents salad and thought he said it was good it was really over priced for some lettuce and chicken. A few small tweaks and this place would be 5 stars all the way.

r-r5IYvr-0C2lXuXld37nQ.text: Food was above average but service was subpar.  Server tried to steer us off the happy hour menu to order full price items because they were better.  Lol. We order cheaper food so we can order better drinks.   Anyway, half our food order never came.  Won't be back unless we sit at the bar.  Food was average, service was a negative, drinks were good, beer list was good.

hjT0t4dRhmD3spm_IuQ0bw.text: Had the new special stuffed ground elk peppers. Not good at all and I like this place. The elk was warm at best way over cooked and dry. The peppers were almost raw just warm a bit. Not what I expected . What a way to ruin elk meat. Was gonna send it back but for what to throw into microwave . Come on guys u can do better

9CxZXsbaTaiOKwk10NPAog.text: Very good food...had the steak salad...good service...that's all I need...no complaints...

gYV7RFe57fNcafBt-MS1zQ.text: Server was quick & knowledgeable! Large selection of beers- but not all available- even at 5pm. My smoke stack sandwich was delicious along with the sweet potato fries. Husband's farm burger was disappointing- meat & bacon were both bland.

NOKrmOUKvUFHZ_xhWt0JnQ.text: great atmosphere, great food, and extensive drink list! I had a large dinner party here of about 15 and the server we had was very attentive. the food was excellent! I had wings and my boyfriend had the rueben, We all shared some apps the fried pickles were ok (they were spears) and the truffle fries were tasty.

kiSKgiB9OJvgV0BZlM7Mlw.text: I went here alone. I only wanted to sit at the bar and have a beer and burger. Mission: Accomplished.   However, that came with extensive waiting and uncomfortable eye contact with the bartender while he mixed drinks for other tables. They weren't busy but it seemed the staff was overwhelmed.   I decided to sit at the upstairs bar as the 1st floor was 1/2 filled and didn't want to sit next to anyone. The upstairs was slightly empty and plenty of seating at the bar.   I sat there for 10-15 minutes while the wait staff were standing around and talking. No bartender in sight. He returned and made a few drinks and didn't acknowledge me. To me, a simple "I'll be right with you" would have been sufficient. Towards the end of making a few drinks he acknowledged me (right before I almost left).  Once I was waited on, the experience took a turn for the better. The bartender asked what I wanted... now keep in mind, the drink list is large. It can be a bit overwhelming. I asked the bartender his recommendation, gave my specifics and he delivered. It was perfect. I tried a few additional samples to make sure. I'm not sure what beer he chose and I didn't ask.   I requested a food menu and skimmed it for a few minutes. I decided to start with an appetizer. I ordered the Mozerella Cogs, these are amazing, highly recommended. Shortly after my burger came (perfect timing, i had a few minutes to relax before the burger). I ordered the Management Burger, great burger, cooked perfectly. I ordered this without mushrooms and onions and left the bleu cheese and bacon. The bleu cheese was too much and that's all you could taste. Towards the middle of the burger I needed to scrape some of the cheese off. Other than that, it was a very good burger. The fries were amazing!  Overall the experience was not what I was expecting but the food and beer made up for the lack of customer interaction.
