XWvaXLYov0e1XNN5vAJcWg.text: This is my second time at Industry Public House. The first was for a work Christmas party and the last visit was for lunch.  I had the smoke stack hand held sandwich and it was pretty good. Nothing amazing really and kinda messy. But it did taste good. My wife had the fish and chips and said she like it just fine.  They have a good selection of beer on tap and I made the most of my opportunity. I tried a few of the house beers and liked them both. One thing I do really like is that they use the digital pour app. It's a great app that shows you what is on tap, how much each beer costs, and how much is left in the keg! Really like that!  Anyways, the food was decent as was the service. Might stop by again if I'm in the area.

mBdNVJCcxKfWjcW2ldHeVg.text: This parking lot is littered with places to watch games and enjoy time out with friends. There's a Tilted Kilt and Quaker, Steak & Lube (and even a Max & Erma's). We walked in to Industry Public House because it was local rather than a national chain. Meanwhile, expecting a sports bar, it was clear that wasn't the case here. On a Friday night, March Madness was on, the restaurant was packed and not a single person inside was watching any of the games on the big screens.   Industry Public House is a a place middle age people come to socialize. We walked in wearing sweats and sports hoodies (to watch games) and were more than out of place. The crowd was mostly mid thirties to mid 50s and well dressed, not dressed in a fancy way, but much nicer than casual. This is a place to be seen, to enjoy a stretched out dinner or drinks with friends or for a special occasion, rather than a quick bite to watch a sporting event. There's a few TVs but many aren't placed in areas that are conducive to watching multiple games. Alcohol and conversation is more important. If you're trying to avoid the 18-25 year old crowd you'll likely accomplish that here.   Industry brings many things to the table; great service, an inviting, upbeat atmosphere, large flat screens and better than you'd expect food. In fact, the food here blows away that you'll find at the competition. I expected to pay more for the atmosphere and quality of food. Meanwhile, it's well priced.   The menu isn't geared toward entrees, rather appetizers, burgers and wraps, all of which taste like they're prepared in house with quality ingredients. Take the wings for example. They are made with fresh, premium chicken and are well seasoned. You won't find the traditional heavily breaded wings, rather lightly breaded and lots of meat. The sandwiches and burgers are made to impress as well. Do try the Model T Turkey that comes with fresh sliced turkey and the Reuben. You can't go wrong.

ys52BlbvmUycTbUX70VviQ.text: We were in the Robinson area today & decided to stop in for a late lunch.  We started off with the cheesesteak fritters. They were served at a nice temperature & with a dipping sauce.  I ordered the Arsenal Chicken salad. It was a decent size. Nothing special but no complaints about it.  My husband ordered the Lamb burger & fries.  Nice presentation & good flavor.  Our server was friendly & attentive.  The seating can be a bit awkward. Some tables make you feel as if you are joining another party for dinner. It is called a public house so maybe that's the point.

hoioIuoFZsxCUuwMtPbYIQ.text: Great whisk(e)y selection, whether you want to scrimp or splurge.  Interesting additives, like smoking your pours.  The popcorn is a great snack while sipping your cocktail and chatting with friends.

Wu7u6V1lnthvE11Cc0DsAA.text: A+ for the beer selection C for food | price | service I would go back to sit at the bar and drink a craft beer. Otherwise, skip it. The meals were pricey for gastropub fare. We both wanted to substitute the fries with our meals and it was an up charge of $2!!!

N-cjbc_3UZrr76sEv6s76A.text: NOT the place to book an event!! I am so, SO disappointed that we chose to have our annual staff Christmas party at Industry Public House in Robinson!! The whole process, including the party itself, was a disaster and, as the person "in charge" of planning the party, I am embarrassed.  The manager that I worked with, Colin, let me know during the initial phone call that he preferred to communicate through email. The only problem with that is, he rarely responded to my emails until I sent him a "reminder" email, which was a bit frustrating.  We booked the upstairs bar area and chose to go with the 7 appetizer package at $17/person. TWO DAYS prior to our event, we were notified that there was another party booked in the upstairs bar area for earlier in the day and they were worried that they would stay longer, so they asked if we would move down to the "Sunroom."  There is no bar in the Sunroom, so I inquired what the bar service would be like. Colin assured me that we would have SEVERAL servers that were "well trained in serving large parties." When we got there, we had TWO servers for 45 people!! Several guests told me that when they got tired of waiting for a server and went to the bar themselves to get a drink that they were "scolded" by the bartenders who told them that they should be ordering from the servers - this made me very angry. I was a server for YEARS and I just know that this is so unprofessional. You do not treat paying guests this way!!!  To add insult to injury, when the server brought me the check for the food, I was appalled! We had 45 confirmed guests, 2 of which ended up not coming, so I assumed our number was at 43. They told me that they had counted 54 people and were charging us for that!! When I objected to this, the server got a bit "snippy" with me and told me that they had counted twice. At this point, I was so frustrated, that I explained the situation to one of my colleagues and had him go talk to her. Several minutes later, she apologized, saying that perhaps they had accidentally counted people from another party. She charged us for 45 people and we paid the tab. Not long after, she approached me again and said "I don't mean to be pushy, but that price did NOT include gratuity." If you've ever planned an event for a large group like this, I'm sure you know that gratuity SHOULD BE included in the price. Then, if the servers do an outstanding job, you tip more on top of that, which, as a former server, I always do.   The food itself was NOT worth the $17/person that we paid.  The flatbreads were very good, but the pot roast French fries were not very good and were certainly not appealing to look at. The boneless wings left a lot to be desired and were overly spicy. The best part was the truffled popcorn, but it disappeared rather quickly.  As you can gather from my review, I will NOT be returning to this establishment for any reason. I don't like to write reviews like this, but I feel like I needed to do this as a public service. Having worked in the service industry for years, I completely understand that sometimes you can have an "off" night, but, unfortunately, this was not that. A True disappointment.

GwL7ZoDDIzXNKHjotKYOfg.text: This place was great! It's located in Robinson Town Center. The wait for a table at 8pm was one hour so we went to the upstairs bar and sat right down.   The bartenders were very friendly and the service was crazy fast. We had Valeria as our bartender/server.  They have tons of beer on tap. They have these amazing whiskey drinks that they make using fire and various flavored wood chips. We didn't try one but we heard others saying how good they were. The passion fruit kicker wheat beer was very light and tasty. They let you taste a sample before choosing if you prefer.   Appetizers: if you don't try the candied bacon you are missing the best thing on the menu. WOW! It's unbelievably delicious!   Dinners: they don't have a huge selection, so don't expect pages of options. They had about 10 things to choose from. My friend had a burger and said it "was ok". I ordered the smokehouse sandwich. It was strips of steak (similar to a Philly cheese steak), aged white cheddar, horseradish sauce, and arugula on sourdough toast. It was very tasty and extremely filling. It had the perfect amount of ingredients. The sandwich was served with a side and I chose sweet potato fries. They were sweet potato waffle fries with cinnamon and powdered sugar on them. Wow they were delicious!   Overall, extremely good and looking forward to going back again soon.

GAlZcs1kABbLR9i5ez1xiA.text: In town working for a few weeks and have been here numerous times. The atmosphere is fantastic and there is a great patio. Everything I have ordered has been great and the servers and bartenders have been very pleasant and attentive

tVhWimAYSyk07zE6gprFLA.text: This place is one of my favorite spots. There are tons of great beers and the draft list is always changing so you never know what you are going to get, which is great.   The boneless wings are awesome, the siracha flatbed is awesome, the truffle fries are awesome. The place is huge and open and has a great outdoor patio. It is everything you want in a great local bar.   The last 2 times I was there, the wait staff was a little grumpy...but the other 3 times they were friendly...so I know it isn't the norm.

lNjfLn8xDCPZt4u3n-9eKg.text: Service was very very slow. Forgot our drinks at the bar. Bison burger and Brussels sprouts sounded good but were not good. Buffalo Mac flatbread was good

ZZhHnV2Qi7uaTw8Y47-xng.text: Ok here is why I can only give 1 star. Food and beer is good. What sucks and is most disappointing is the staff. Waited 15 minutes before a server showed up at our table. We actually were ready to leave when someone finally showed up. The couple next to us actually left since they were not served either. Two tables next to us, a waitress just chatted away. She did see that we weren't waited on but didn't bother to either get another waiter or just come over and ask us what we would like to order. They (she) obviously didn't care about other customers. Very disappointed. I might give it another try but 3 strikes and they are out. Get your act together or you won't last in the restaurant business.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8b-BnoEg99BAq2Ku3-W6Dg.text: Got carry out from here in July when we were stopping in Pittsburgh for a night. We got three salads and some appetizers. The salads were solid, as were most of the appetizers. But the nachos were the worst. Basically we got some chips with shredded cheese on them with small containers of pico de gallo and small jalapenos. No guac, no cream cheese, no olives- all things that were advertised. This was really a bummer, since that's what we ordered for our kids. Other than that, a pretty solid place.

X-PTSCW-NSAqp4RlERzo4A.text: Wide selection of draft beer and a bar menu.  If you're looking for a place to taste beer you normally don't get a chance to sample, this is a good place to go.  It's simply okay for food.  I think food is secondary to beer at Industry.    For example, the crab cake sandwich is in reality a BLT with a small, mostly breadcrumb crab cake.  Bacon's their thing at Industry.  Caution:  the music is terribly loud at Industry.  Not a place for date night as you'll be shouting and saying, "what?" a lot.

sIVUmArsfkqNf75bamm9ng.text: Really good food!  I had their version of a turkey club, the garlic aoli on it was great, and the fresh cut fries were delicious.  My husband had the farmed out Burger that comes with an egg on it, he said it was great too.  3 stars for 2 reasons - 1, our beers were semi-warm and almost undrinkable.  2 - we went to order the Leona's ice cream sandwiches for dessert, and were informed that their freezer was broken for a bit earlier, and that we'd have to wait 15-20 min for them to re-freeze?  We obviously said no, but this makes me worry that the food may not be stored safely if they would still serve something that has to take the time to re-freeze.

uR58rhGpeuaCowHouteNYg.text: My daughter and I stopped in for burgers one weekend and were very pleased. Not only were the burgers exceptional but so was Sophia, our waitress. She had a very bubbly personality and you could tell she was knowledgeable about the menu. If you are in the area, stop in, grab a burger and ask for Sophia!

io4SgIEpwlDVPs_n5P83aw.text: Food was ok, but service is a word not used in this restaurant.  We hardly saw our waitress and watched as a couple got up and walked out. The hostess watched them leave and seemed to care less. I would have rather went somewhere else.

N2Zm4pI0DNBzAkK1Mp0IWw.text: Food is decent. My burger was good. Fried pickles and stuffed jalapenos were tasty. The sangria tasted like juice. It was Annoying that they told us a 40 min wait but it ended up being over an hour and a half and they sat us right in front of the door. It was so cold I had to wear my winter coat the whole meal but we were so hungry we just dealt with it!  I don't think we would eat here again. There are too many choices in larryville

SkmCClMFubqLI2OofVrllw.text: I came here a couple of weeks ago on a weeknight with a few people.  It wasn't too packed as we grabbed a table and most people were sitting at the bar.  It's a cool spot.  I'm not sure if it's a chain or not but I think it might be.  If I'm wrong, my bad.  They had an awesome draft list - at least 30-35 beers on tap and a number of IPAs to choose from.    We didn't do meals - just some drinks and apps.  I would highly recommend their pretzel; it is enormous and about 4 people can easily share it.  I also really liked their buffalo chicken flatbread.  It's the perfect place to do some drinks and some apps although I'd be glad to give their meals a shot next time.

S-WcVVVNxCjsn-k2FK-1Tw.text: A-OK, just like the description for the 3 star says. I've never had a bad meal, but nothing has ever knocked my socks off either.   I do have to give special mention the Blast Pig burger, which was really awesome and probably what I will get from now on. It really had some unique toppings that went well together.   Service is usually alright. Nothing to write home about. Overall, it's a good standard place where you know what you're gonna get. Always good to have a few of those in your arsenal :)

Suxm8gkbo6NYkKCo61P3zw.text: Great service, great food, great atmosphere.  Unique place with nice outdoor seating and done in such a way as to be totally new.  The menu drink list almost has too much.  Two pages of beer, a page of whiskeys and bourbons...scotch....a pretzel the size of your head.  For drinks, I ordered two house made items.  The Copper Ale, and the House Rye Whiskey.  The copper ale was one of those beers that has flavor but not too heavy.    The house Whiskey was interesting.  Surprisingly good flavor reminiscent of a Balvanie scotch, but does finish showing its three year age (a burn).    Great experience, fast service, and a unique atmosphere, which for those who like eating out, is difficult with all of the chains.

oUAAj666P1hvd60r23hxkw.text: Stopped in for lunch today with my wife while I am in town on business.  Decor and atmosphere were great! Lots of TV's and the visual peek into the brewery pipeline was interesting.  Was early for lunch and while there were few others present, we were seated right next to a table with a large group.  I should have asked to move but did not.  Food quality:  so-so.  I had the honey ginger wings and a cup of chilli.  The chilli was good but a bit sweet.  The wings were really nothing to brag about...not even sure I could say they were as good as B'dubs as they were a bit skimpy and lukewarm.    The wife had a chicken salad sandwich which was on special today, however, the waitress (Jessica) brought out a grilled cheese sandwich.  My wife who doesn't like to complain told me she'd eat it anyway but I convinced her not to eat something that she did not order. The waitress came up to our table at that point and apologized when I questioned her whether this was a grilled cheese or chicken salad. She immediately took back the plate to the kitchen and said that "they probably just moved the plates around in front of me and i did not notice."  Finally, she brought out the right plate (as I was finishing my lunch up) and my wife indicated while the sandwich was good, the fries on the previous plate were much better than the current version as they were soggy and barely cooked.  After the waitress picked up the plates, she slapped the bill down and said "ok, pay me when you're ready."  Jessica is probably a nice person who was having a bad day but the appearance of apathy and lack of caring in doing your job and being cheerful to a new visitor to your business is essential.  I tipped her almost 15% based on the benefit of the doubt, as I usually tip 20-25% and hate to not leave a tip unless the service was unbearable.  Not sure I'll be back as I'm only in town a few days...the bar area looked interesting and a place that I could spend a few hours at post-workday, though!

DwNUp-2B50ZQneoJvo0yOg.text: After only one visit this elegant bar may need to be revisited to see if what was displayed or hidden from view is really worth the effort to bow down to a bar that doesn't appear to have IC light on draft, a pretty simple act given the intent of what is being promoted.  I look for a second opportunity to groom what appears to be a pretty young attempt to peak my interests and appetite.

LH7cwznx2sVlC1fwAI56YQ.text: I like this place! Awesome beer selection! Decent food! Decent prices!!! Gets real crowded I. Weekend nights!

r1c48KeO9P_JPoaaYb02vQ.text: Last night we had our Christmas work party here and it was perfect! We reserved the top floor that includes a bartender and room for over 30 people on just one side. We had 6 appetizer buffet that was prepaid with a cash bar. The place was clean, perfect environment , and the workers were all so nice! I suggest going here for large group, showers, and work meeting! The food was fantastic!  Thank you Frank for making it easy to set up and Dustin for bartending!!! Cheers!

tUQc5_85-H4sbxYXh9PxYg.text: One of the better options I've had so far in Pitt.  I've been here several times as I am temporarily in the airport area until I fully relocate.  The drinks are tasty, the beer selection is AWESOME especially if you like porters and more hearty ales.  I've tried a couple porters here that were just deeeeeelightful.  And the one bartender with the dark hair and beard (sorry, I forgot his name!!) was so spot on in giving me suggestions for beer.  The food is pretty dang good too and the staff is friendly.  It is LOUD though sometimes so be prepared for that, especially when it is busy - the acoustics in the place just amplify the heck out of the crowd noise.  I love that they play various sports on the screen, not just football.  And the setting is very trendy instead of boring or divey.  Wish there was another Industry location in Pitt (hint hint, north side?)  The spot where I didn't give it full stars was the pricing.  It seemed pretty expensive for some of the burger options - and given the lower salaries in this city, it feels like I am paying for a Seattle-based burger brewpub instead of Pitt.  I have lived in so many cities in the past couple years where I got to enjoy extended happy hours so it bums me out when I can never make it to the happy hour here.    Also, I wish there was a small bites menu offered all the time to help offset the cost of the entrees because I would eat here more often if there was.  For example, if I could get just a burger with no fries and save myself $3 that would be pretty sweet.  Or a soup option with small pretzel... just wishful thinking.

0fHnVDCXSNygoikHWsLejw.text: Was very impressed @ the Lawrenceville location. They were  using fresh juices for their drinks. Hip vibe inside with numerous choices on their menu. Truffle loaded fries were a treat .

PASpXn4TvzeqiYFn2ThrgQ.text: Went here for lunch relatively recently (just now getting around to writing review) and although the place looked nice I was thoroughly disappointed. Our waiter, whose name I don't know because he never introduced himself, provided poor service which really ruined the whole lunch. Although the restaurant was far from crowded, he never checked on us. After taking our orders almost an hour passed before he came back to tell my friend they were out of what she had ordered, leading us to wonder if he had ever even put her order in to start... I ordered some kind of fancy grilled cheese sandwich which doesn't appear to be on their menu anymore and the food was awful. There was hardly any cheese on my sandwich and it was dry. The fries were SO salty I gagged on them, it tasted like I bit into a block of pure salt. I asked the waiter to bring the manager but eventually had to go find him myself. At least they were nice enough to not charge me considering I didn't touch my meal, but the waiter never apologized nor did he remove my meal from the table after I told him I didn't want it. Hopefully that waiter isn't working there anymore...

StxIDYSBhStlgWqhWKGFdA.text: Fantastic place to eat and drink. I've been to the location in Lawrenceville and remember thinking it was just "ok". That was a couple years back. This trip today has definitely confirmed for me to come back.  Great beer selection for all beer drinkers. Great food selection. Wife got the plain burger, very juicy and very delicious. I got the grilled Mahi Tacos...amazing. Better than some I've had in seafood towns!  This place is worth a shot without a doubt.

Iv1hz8InBmgElug3zlWsbg.text: This was a welcomed surprise while shopping in Robinson area. After reading other reviews, the key must be to avoid happy hour. Brunch on a snowy Sunday morning was great. The menu options forced us into tough decision-making! Anything with bacon is highly recommended. It was meaty and flavorful not greasy or fatty. My boyfriend got the fish and chips and the fish was falling off the plate it was so large. Nicely battered and good flavor.  The wait staff was fine, not overly attentive, but enough.  Looking forward to trying more of the menu.

ml5hvZh7uQMIPD9Ycffo8Q.text: Went to Industry in Robinson for a birthday celebration. The restaurant has a cool atmosphere and the server was very nice and accommodating. I ordered the electric chicken and it was very good and very spicy. They have a large selection of beers and whiskeys. I will definitely be back and want to check out the other location.

fmQhOC_48OnK78CdNbVTpQ.text: We stumbled upon this gem when we couldn't decide where to grab a quick lunch & almost settled for Quaker Steak & Lube. Nothing against QSL but we like to try new places. The beer selection was broad & the menu was interesting. We opted for mild wings, 9th Ward Salad and the Shroomed flat bread. The wings were perfect & our other options were comparable. We will definitely return. It was a gorgeous day & it's always a plus when you can dine outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shroomed Flat Bread

Ry91rT1_GPWy--tsM-io2A.text: This restaurant will absolutely will be seeing me again. Heather, our server, was amazing ! She did an excellent job. The place was very very busy! She was running around so much but checked on us the perfect amount of time.   Our table ordered a good amount of food. The tuna appetizer was perfection ! It was so delicious and the candied bacon is to die for. I order the blasted pig burger and it was  so good ! So much heat but so good.  I had wine , but the whiskey smoked was very good esp with the maple chips. If you love whiskey, this is the option.  The menu is pricey but we knew that going in so just be aware of that. It's definitely worth the trip !

g-FF7bkUioLYdRyMQn9O7Q.text: IPH is a regular in our eating out rotation, we love it there! Their ever changing selection of beers is absolutely the best. There's definitely something for everyone and if you don't like beer, tons of cocktails can be made! The service here, especially if you sit at the bar, I feel it goes above and beyond. The bartenders always make an effort to chat with you a bit and get to know you. I'm not sure if we could be considered 'regulars' but I feel like we are when they remember us even if it's been a while!   The food at IPH is also really delicious. I definitely would recommend the Arsenal chicken salad! Their happy hour deals are awesome too, the entry level burger..YUM! Top your meal off with a Leona's ice cream sandwich, and trust me you will be a happy camper!

0lfc-3Cyf35mzLhSrOlLrg.text: Neat little place in Pittsburgh. We came here really late after a Kenny Chesney concert. We were glad to see they were still open. Their late night menu is pretty limited but it was good enough for us. I had a burger and my wife had a buffalo chicken sandwich. Everything was great. Food was outstanding, as was the service. The bill was not expensive. The atmosphere of the place is really cool too. Looks like an old warehouse/factory.

Y8Ck-_385wREn4eGZwwuQQ.text: What a great space! After going to the lawrenceville location quite often, I didn't know what to expect in this new Robinson location... But it definitely exceeded what I imagined. The space is huge and open with the same vibe as the original location. Lots of brick, and great tables and decor. Their beer selection is always so good with lots of options. I also enjoy their happy hour!   The food at industry is never at the top of my list when I think of places to eat. However, if you're looking for a drink or happy hour specials I'd definitely recommend it.

YS-uY8Z8HFKV7n9E3GaHPQ.text: I was so thrilled when I heard they opened a second location in Robinson because each time I'd try to visit the Lawrenceville location, it would be a several hour wait. Finally made it out to Robinson and I was rather happy with my experience.   On a Saturday afternoon, there really weren't too many people there so we were able to get a table in no time. The space is large and well decorated with a modern atmosphere. The menu wasn't all too varied and it seemed that sandwiches and burgers dominated the menu, but each seemed to be loaded with a variety of different toppings that made it a very tough decision. Everything sounded delicious but I had to settle with one item so I got the Eliza Chicken and the hubby got the Worker Burgher. After a bite of each of these, I've come to realize that any bite of their food is an explosion of flavor! Bold, spicy, and what you'd expect to be served at a hip gastropub. The chicken on the Eliza Chicken, however, was a tad bit dry and rather thin. The sandwich seemed to be dominated by the toppings rather than the chicken, which probably attributed to the explosive flavor so it was enjoyable nonetheless.   I think this was a good addition to the Robinson area. I will definitely be back, as I hear their brunch is out of this world as well as their drinks!

Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eliza Chicken
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eliza Chicken

UlgN4SH-G8wCqD5-8vM9lQ.text: great facility, awesome food and good service. LOUD PODCAST started up on stage and had to leave.

GfihmTW6QMY1eYix1awHkw.text: Love the atmosphere here, so much more lively than the original location. The food is excellent, and the servers are very attentive and friendly. The drafts were a little hit-or-miss as to if they were still available, but my server had a handheld and was able to let me known immediately what was available. Will be back for sure!

xciSqvI4_cLMNvEOalP8XQ.text: Really disappointed. Good atmosphere, great waitress. Menus make selecting things a bit If a hassle - too noisy and gimmicky. Was excited to try the smoke whiskey's. Don't- they add a syrup, the glass was sticky. It was over smoked with wood chips. Not sure what process they use but for $149 they make a contraption that does it right. Food was ok. Great concept just not executed very well.
